Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives on designing and deploying scalable ML solutions?




This is your opportunity to join an innovative organization where your expertise will drive data-driven decision-making and business success! You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies, build robust ML pipelines, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Developing and maintaining data pipelines using Python and tools like Apache Airflow and Kafka.
Building, training, and deploying machine learning models for production environments.
Conducting software testing and ensuring the reliability of ML solutions.
Managing relational and NoSQL databases for efficient data storage and querying.
Implementing CI/CD pipelines and using Docker/Kubernetes for deployment.
Utilizing cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) for infrastructure management.
Documenting workflows and best practices for data engineering and ML processes.




Essential Skills:




✅ 5+ years of experience in data engineering and machine learning roles

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Experience with Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Airflow, and Kafka

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Strong understanding of Agile, Scrum, and DevOps methodologies

✅ Experience with CI/CD pipeline management and Docker/Kubernetes




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of simulations, optimization algorithms
Knowledge of real-time data streaming.







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Work on high-impact ML projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Show more

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer passionate about building and deploying predictive models that shape business decisions? This is your chance to join a dynamic media organisation in Amsterdam, where your expertise will drive innovation and transform data into actionable insights.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing, developing, and deploying predictive ML models to enhance business strategy and customer engagement.
Building and optimising data pipelines for model training, evaluation, and deployment.
Working with time-series forecasting, recommendation systems, and audience behaviour analysis.
Managing large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality and accessibility.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and product managers.
Implementing CI/CD workflows and containerisation using Docker and Kubernetes.
Leveraging cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP) to deploy scalable ML solutions.
Mentoring junior engineers and guiding interns in best ML practices.




Essential Skills:




✅ Dutch

✅ Machine Learning Development – End-to-end ML solution development

✅ Python Programming – Proficiency in Python/ ML model development.

✅ Data Engineering – Experience with data pipelines.

✅ AI & Deep Learning – Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow/ PyTorch.

✅ Cloud Platforms – Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP.

✅ CI/CD & DevOps – Experience with continuous integration/ deployment.

✅ Containerisation & Orchestration – Docker/ Kubernetes.




Bonus Skills:




Experience in media analytics, recommendation engines, or personalised content models.
Knowledge of real-time data processing and streaming technologies.
Familiarity with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.







Work on cutting-edge ML projects that directly impact millions of users.




A hybrid working model – 2 days in-office, the rest remote.




A great culture that fosters innovation, learning, and career growth.










If you’re ready to push the boundaries of AI, apply now and be part of something extraordinary!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Als AI & ML Engineer bij VisionBI houd je je bezig met het ontwikkelen van innovatieve en state-of-the-art oplossingen op het gebied van Artificial Intelligence en Machine Learning. Je werkt binnen het Microsoft ecosysteem en bent bedreven in technologieën zoals Azure OpenAI, Large Language Models (LLM), Python en PyTorch. Generative AI en andere geavanceerde AI-technieken behoren tot jouw gereedschapskist.




Je bent nieuwsgierig en analytisch en weet complexe AI-oplossingen te vertalen naar praktische toepassingen voor onze klanten. Samen met hen werk je aan de meest efficiënte en effectieve oplossingen, waarbij je rekening houdt met zowel de technische als de zakelijke kant. Je begrijpt het belang van goede communicatie en samenwerking binnen een team en werkt veelal Agile/Scrum om samen met jouw team tot de juiste oplossing te komen. Dagelijkse stand-ups en teamoverleg zijn voor jou vanzelfsprekend.




De ideale werkweek betekent voor jou dat je gemiddeld twee dagen op de klantlocatie werkt en de resterende dagen desgewenst vanuit ons kantoor in De Meern of gewoon remote. Ook al zien we elkaar niet elke dag, het VisionBI team staat altijd voor je klaar!




Dit ga je nog meer doen: Naast dat je als AI & ML Engineer werkt aan uiteenlopende projecten voor VisionBI klanten, volg je de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van AI en Machine Learning op de voet. Je hebt een passie voor het ontwikkelen en trainen van AI-modellen en bent bedreven in het implementeren van geavanceerde algoritmes en dataverwerkingspipelines. Je werkt met cutting-edge technologieën zoals LLM’s, transformer-based modellen en generatieve AI om innovatieve oplossingen te realiseren. Daarnaast werk je samen met data engineers en software ontwikkelaars om robuuste en schaalbare AI-oplossingen te bouwen die direct impact hebben op de business.




Wat je meebrengt: Het liefst heb je een op AI, Data Science of Informatica gerichte HBO of WO opleiding afgerond. Na het afronden van jouw opleiding heb je reeds meer da 2 jaar relevante werkervaring. Stap je net de universiteit buiten, laat je dan niet afschrikken en geef een gil. Ook onze opleidingsmogelijkheden zullen de start van jouw carrière een mooie kick-start geven.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Enthousiaste en zeer kundige nieuwe collega’s!
Mobiliteitsplan - erop uit.
Een telefoonabonnement - hallo wie is daar?
Een laptop - in de schoot geworpen.
Collectieve pensioenregeling - we worden allemaal ouder.
25 vakantiedagen – even lekker weg.
Gave VisionBI-uitjes – overal en nergens.
Focus op kennisdeling en verbreding – Je staat toch niet stil?
Royale opleidingsmogelijkheden - jouw carrière in de lift.
Ruime flexibiliteit waar het gaat om remote werken – lekker nieuwerwets.
Mis je nog iets? - Het zou kunnen ;)




Wat vragen wij van jou?

Een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding in een technische richting.
Gerichte werkervaring (>2 jaar).
Goede zelfkennis, weten wat je kunt en wat je nog wenst te leren.
Jouw passie is een combinatie van AI, data én de mens.
Analytisch sterk ontwikkelde vaardigheden.
Pragmatisch, maar altijd kritisch op kwaliteit.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse (must) en Engelse taal.
Uitstekend ontwikkelde sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden.




Jouw technische vaardigheden:

Python – uiteraard.
Machine Learning frameworks zoals PyTorch, TensorFlow en Scikit-Learn.
Generative AI en Large Language Models (LLM's).
Azure OpenAI en andere Azure AI-diensten.
Data Engineering skills zoals werken met Databricks, Synapse Analytics en Azure ML.
Cloud computing en DevOps (Azure DevOps, CI/CD voor ML-modellen).
Kennis van MLOps en model deployment technieken.
SQL en NoSQL databases voor AI toepassingen.
Andere gerelateerde kennis die je hier niet ziet staan? ….laat het ons weten!




Waarom VisionBI?

Dagelijks zorgen we ervoor dat onze klanten beschikken over slimme en innovatieve AI-oplossingen. Wij houden ervan om vernieuwend en vooruitstrevend te zijn. We zoeken altijd de uitdaging op, en dat geldt natuurlijk ook voor jou. Kom jij met nieuwe ideeën om ons en jezelf verder te laten groeien? Wil je écht iets anders? Dan is VisionBI de plek voor jou om te werken.

Daarnaast brengen we je ook helemaal up to speed met maandelijkse kennissessies via ons Center of Excellence.




Onze manier van werken:

We bieden iedereen een persoonlijk opleidingsplan.
We geven ondersteuning waar nodig om je te laten groeien in je werk.
Je ambities worden gehoord en daar acteren we dan ook op.
Reizen is geen doel op zich, we werken zo flexibel mogelijk.
Work-life balance is voor ons belangrijk.




Kom VisionBI ontdekken en versterken, solliciteer vandaag nog.




We maken graag kennis! Face to face of via Teams. Wat vind jij fijn?

Show more

  • Work-life balance is voor ons belangrijk.


Kom VisionBI ontdekken en versterken, solliciteer vandaag nog.


We maken graag kennis! Face to face of via Teams. Wat vind jij fijn?

Title: Research And Development Scientist
Description:
At S[&]T we contribute to a safer life on Earth by translating space data into valuable and actionable insights. With this, we help organizations, governments and commercial entities to strengthen their information position and thereby improve their decision-making. We focus on 4 domains: Space & Science, Defence & Security, Environment & Sustainability and the High-Tech Industry. We control all levels of the data value chain from data source to user applications, and apply our expertise within our innovations, customer projects and talent acquisition services. Our headquarters are in Delft, The Netherlands and we have two satellite offices in Oslo, Norway and Rome, Italy with a total of 125 experts employed at S[&]T.




We are currently looking for an R&D Scientist to join the team in Eindhoven.




Integrated photonics is transforming industries by enabling advancements in communication, healthcare, energy efficiency, and data security. A leading research and development initiative is driving innovation in this field, bridging the gap between fundamental research and real-world applications.




With access to state-of-the-art facilities and world-class technology platforms, this initiative fosters collaboration between academia and industry. The focus is on developing next-generation photonic chip technologies, accelerating their adoption, and creating solutions for high-impact applications.




This role offers an exciting the opportunity to be at the forefront of integrated photonics research and development. It involves working closely with industry leaders in the high-tech sector while contributing to cutting-edge advancements in photonic-electronic integration.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and validate optical and electronic interconnect and assembly processes for next-generation photonic devices and systems.
Support the selection and implementation of commercial chip assembly equipment.
Contribute to the development of high-speed (>10,000 UPH) and high-accuracy assembly processes.
Collaborate with international customers and research partners, sharing expertise and driving key project developments.




Requirements:

PhD in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, materials science, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in the semiconductor industry, with a focus on advanced chip packaging and high-precision chip assembly.
Proven expertise in designing and fabricating optical and electronic interconnects.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with international partners.




This position is ideal for individuals passionate about translating cutting-edge research into practical applications within integrated photonics.




This position offers a dynamic and engaging work environment within a high-tech international team. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting engineering challenges, collaborate with experienced professionals, and make a direct impact on the future of motion control and test technology.




Interested? Then click to apply or send your CV and motivation letter to recruitment@stcorp.nl.




Privacy Notice: In order to apply for this vacancy, you must submit your personal information to Science [&] Technology. Science [&] Technology will collect, use, and process your personal information as mentioned in our Privacy Policy. Our policy and processing of your personal information are compliant with the GDPR.




Please note that if you do not hear back from us within 10 days of your application, you may assume that we have selected another candidate we would like to interview for this position. We do our best to get back to you individually; however, due to a high volume of responses, it can be that we have not been able to reject your application in person.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about constructing AI systems that unlock predictive insights at an unprecedented scale? Can you design and implement solutions using cutting-edge LLM and deep learning technologies? Don't hesitate—apply now!

In a nutshell


Hop on a journey with an exciting fast-growing SaaS company in an international environment (steep learning curve is guaranteed).
Secure an impactful role with lots of growth potential for yourself.
Spearhead innovative initiatives on the intersection of AI/ML and NLP.
Develop scalable and accurate AI models that deliver predictive insights beyond human capacity.
Join a team of diverse and passionate people with a culture that empowers great work (15 ninjas & 10 nationalities).
Enjoy a lot of perks: Flexible working hours & unlimited holiday policy, attractive office in Amsterdam, visa sponsorship, mentorship program, own laptop & home equipment, team events & games... (and more!).



🧑‍💻 What are we doing?

At Kaizo, we're not just building a platform - we're creating a dynamic ecosystem that actively guides employees to achieve their goals and make a lasting impact on their organizations. Our focus is on revolutionizing the daily work experience for customer support teams through a performance development and compliance platform that combines cutting-edge AI technologies with gamification.


AI-Powered Engagement: We're leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies to improve operational efficiency, enhance team performance, and provide unparalleled performance visibility. Our goal is to make the daily work experience more engaging, fun, and productive for customer support agents, quality assurance professionals, and team leaders.
Stream Processing Excellence: Built on a microservices-based stream processing platform, we process over 200 million events per day using cutting-edge technologies such as Akka Streams and Kafka. Our services, deployed on Kubernetes in Google Cloud, seamlessly feed data into ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and Google BigQuery.
Developing the Future: Our team is at the forefront of developing AI systems that are not only scalable, affordable, and interpretable but also flexible and empowering. We're pursuing real-time solutions that redefine the way compliance monitoring is done.
Our journey is not without its challenges, and we embrace them as opportunities for innovation:
Scalability Quest: Processing approximately 10 tickets per second requires solutions with lightning-fast inference speeds. We're working on LLMs that match GPT's accuracy but operate at an unparalleled speed.
Cost Efficiency Mandate: Dealing with large ticket volumes requires economically feasible solutions that do not scale linearly in terms of cost with the expected volume. We're on a mission to optimize efficiency and resource utilization.
Accuracy Triumph: Our compliance engine aims for maximum accuracy while maintaining a conservative approach to predictions.
Data Privacy Conundrum: The presence of sensitive PII in our customers' data adds a layer of complexity. We're addressing the challenge of fine-tuning models on raw data while upholding the highest standards of data privacy and security.
Data Diversity Voyage: Dealing with diverse data formats, from text and raw speech to metadata and tabular data, presents its own set of challenges. We navigate this diversity to ensure our solutions are adaptable and comprehensive.



🗓️ What are your 12 labours here?

As a Data Scientist, you will help us implement new features into our product by building and deploying production-grade models that leverage state-of-the-art technologies. Your primary focus will be on developing high quality prediction models that can be integrated with our services, performing statistical analysis, designing scalable AI systems using innovative architecture.

🤖 You will focus on


NLP and NLG using state-of-the-art methods
Improving and extending the features used by our existing systems
Processing, cleaning, and aggregating data used for analysis
Performing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Creating automated systems and tracking their performance
Building and optimising prediction systems using open source and proprietary LLMs
Collaborating with other team-members within the company to drive product development
Communicating results and ideas to key decision makers
Experimenting with different tools and technologies, and evaluate new data science approaches for the business



🧑‍💻 What you bring to the table?


3+ years industry experience
Experience in prototyping and deploying at least one data science project to a production environment
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn and Jupyter Notebooks
Experience with one of the following: Tensorflow, PyTorch, or any other deep learning/machine learning framework
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Dash, Seaborn, D3, etc
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills using Python
Familiarity with MLOps is a plus.
Experience in using one or more of the following tools and technologies is a plus: Google Cloud Platform, Github, Docker, Kubernetes, MongoDB, ElasticSearch
Data-oriented personality
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Being part of an early stage startup, we sometimes need you to wear multiple hats just to keep things going, hence being a team player is a must have.



🏆 What’s in it for you?


An office right in the heart of Amsterdam, complemented by the flexibility of hybrid working
Visa sponsorship available for eligible candidates
Great office gear: MacBook, tools, desks, chair — there’s something for everyone
The freedom of a flexible working schedule
Fun workations & open holiday policy
Show more

  • An office right in the heart of Amsterdam, complemented by the flexibility of hybrid working

Title: Machine Learning/DevOps Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.



In 2009 the office in Amsterdam was opened, which is now situated at the 28th floor of the Rembrandt Tower with a great view on the city of Amsterdam. We focus on the following sectors: Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Marketing & Customer Experience, Data Science and HR, Transformation & Change. The Dutch team is experiencing strong growth and has now built up an impressive client portfolio, supported by and cooperating with colleagues from our international offices. Sia Netherlands employs approximately 60 consultants.





Job Description



Support the development of the activities of the Global Data Science Business Unit. You will join the Amsterdam Data Science team and implement high-performance software solutions hosted on scalable and secure cloud infrastructures for our Data Science projects as well as our internal Heka solutions.



You will be in charge of shaping and executing the future of your expertise within Sia NL. You will work on client projects as well as on building our own Sia AI solutions, together with our NL based data science team and Paris based Heka Engineering team.



Your responsibilities include:



● Cloud services at GCP, AWS and Azure : choice of architecture, use of storage & compute services, cost monitoring and optimization, role management, Infrastructure as Code



● Docker and Kubernetes : containerization & orchestration of applications, management of K8s clusters adapted to Data Science workloads



● Programming in python : development of tools executed on the server side (mass data processing, API REST server, authentication, etc.)



● CI / CD : management of the integration and continuous deployment of our applications and internal platforms, support for the deployment of Data Science projects with our customers



● Infrastructures & Services adapted to Machine Learning : technological watch and implementation of solutions useful to Data Scientists in learning and making their ML models available.





Qualifications


You have at least MSc level in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Embedded Systems, Informatica or related field of study
You have a very good level in Python and have a solid foundation in other languages. You master at least one SQL DBMS (ideally PostgreSQL) and noSQL (ideally MongoDB) and are able to use its advanced features.
You are familiar with at least one cloud service platform (GCP, AWS, Azure) with experience mixing different services within the same project.
You are comfortable using Docker, automating CI / CD pipelines and have a strong desire to gain skills in Kubernetes if you do not have experience with this solution yet.
You are part of the DevOps Culture : support for the code life cycle, from development to deployment and maintenance of applications (a mastery of the Gitlab-CE ecosystem is a plus). You are also familiar with Infrastructure as Code concepts and tools such as Terraform, Ansible or Chef.
You are sensitive to security issues and have experience in implementing application protection solutions (certificate management, HTTPS security, OAuth2 authentication, credential management)
You are driven by a natural curiosity to actively follow the evolution of the sector with strong convictions on the technologies of the moment. You are proactive and able to quickly gain skills in a new technology, both as a team and independently.
You want to get involved and quickly take responsibility for high added value missions within a dynamic structure.
You have the ability to work in a team, an open mind, a sense of analysis and you want to join a motivating professional environment where you will share our values of excellence, entrepreneurship, innovation, the culture of sharing, benevolence, personal / professional life balance.

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with great extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a phone allowance, yearly salary increase and bonuses.
Flexible transport options that match your personal needs.
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline.
You have the opportunity to work from home, with the client or from our inspiring office in Amsterdam.
Working in an international environment creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world.


Additional Information



For more information on our Data Science Practice, visit our showroom:https://www.heka.ai/en







Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
** This is a 5-month contract and a hybrid role requiring two days per week in the office.




Position Description




We are seeking a skilled AI and Machine Learning Consultant to help ramp up AI capabilities within Marketing Activation.
This role will focus on prototyping and deploying machine learning solutions related to generative AI in marketing, communication, personalization, and more.




Job Responsibilities




Develop and deploy AI/ML solutions for marketing use cases (e.g., conversational engines, next best action, segmentation).
Work on predictive modeling, prototyping, and production deployment of ML models.
Collaborate with a team of 5+ data scientists and other stakeholders.
Utilize Google Cloud for model deployment and scaling.




Required Skills and Experience




Python – Strong expertise in writing clean, scalable code
Google Cloud – Experience in cloud-based ML model deployment
Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) – Hands-on experience in building and fine-tuning models
Neural Networks and Deep Learning – Understanding of modern AI techniques
Data Engineering – Ability to work with large datasets and pipeline development

Title: Data Scientist Freelance
Description:
Group Data Scientist (Azure Databricks & GenAI)




Are you passionate about crafting end-to-end data science solutions that transform businesses? Join our Group Digital Team at BME and help shape a powerful data ecosystem across Europe. We collaborate with our Operating Companies on exciting projects involving neural networks, advanced ML solutions, and Azure OpenAI on our Azure Databricks platform.




About the Role

As a Group Data Scientist, you’ll leverage predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and data visualization to tackle diverse challenges—from pricing optimization and recommendation engines to AI-driven process automation. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, data-driven insights that fuel our digital transformation.

Key Responsibilities

Engage & Discover: Partner with commercial and operational teams to translate business needs into data science initiatives.
Data Wrangling & Prep: Collect, cleanse, and transform data from multiple sources (ERP, CRM, SharePoint) using Python (PySpark), SQL, and Power Query.
Exploratory Data Analysis: Uncover trends and patterns through descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and compelling visualizations.
Emerging AI Technologies: Experiment with Azure OpenAI (GenAI) and large language models to identify new business applications.
Predictive Modeling & ML: Develop and deploy regression, classification, clustering, and deep learning models (e.g., neural networks in TensorFlow or PyTorch).
Model Evaluation & MLOps: Validate models with cross-validation, monitor for drift, and manage versions via MLflow/DVC.
Power BI Dashboards: Build interactive, data-rich dashboards in Power BI (using DAX) for commercial, operational, and strategic insights.
Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing: Partner with data engineers and local OpCo data teams to ensure robust data pipelines and train staff on data science best practices.
Documentation & Compliance: Maintain clear, up-to-date documentation and adhere to data privacy/security regulations (GDPR, etc.).

What You’ll Bring

Technical Mastery:
Proficient in Python/PySpark, SQL, and cloud technologies (Azure Databricks).
Hands-on experience with EDA, feature engineering, and model validation.
Solid grasp of mathematics and statistics, including hypothesis testing.
Skilled in Power BI, DAX, and dashboard optimization.
ML/AI Expertise:
Regression, classification, clustering, deep learning methods, and GenAI (Azure OpenAI).
Familiarity with scikit-learn, MLflow, TensorFlow/PyTorch.
Business Acumen & Communication:
Ability to convert complex findings into clear, actionable insights.
Comfortable presenting to stakeholders at all levels.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in a quantitative field.
3+ years of data science experience in a large, complex environment.




Please note that this is a contract role for 6+ months and we require an office presence at our Schiphol HQ 3 days/week.

Show more
HTML:
Group Data Scientist (Azure Databricks & GenAI)


Are you passionate about crafting end-to-end data science solutions that transform businesses? Join our Group Digital Team at BME and help shape a powerful data ecosystem across Europe. We collaborate with our Operating Companies on exciting projects involving neural networks, advanced ML solutions, and Azure OpenAI on our Azure Databricks platform.


About the Role

As a Group Data Scientist, you’ll leverage predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and data visualization to tackle diverse challenges—from pricing optimization and recommendation engines to AI-driven process automation. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, data-driven insights that fuel our digital transformation.

Key Responsibilities

  • Engage & Discover: Partner with commercial and operational teams to translate business needs into data science initiatives.
  • Data Wrangling & Prep: Collect, cleanse, and transform data from multiple sources (ERP, CRM, SharePoint) using Python (PySpark), SQL, and Power Query.
  • Exploratory Data Analysis: Uncover trends and patterns through descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and compelling visualizations.
  • Emerging AI Technologies: Experiment with Azure OpenAI (GenAI) and large language models to identify new business applications.
  • Predictive Modeling & ML: Develop and deploy regression, classification, clustering, and deep learning models (e.g., neural networks in TensorFlow or PyTorch).
  • Model Evaluation & MLOps: Validate models with cross-validation, monitor for drift, and manage versions via MLflow/DVC.
  • Power BI Dashboards: Build interactive, data-rich dashboards in Power BI (using DAX) for commercial, operational, and strategic insights.
  • Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing: Partner with data engineers and local OpCo data teams to ensure robust data pipelines and train staff on data science best practices.
  • Documentation & Compliance: Maintain clear, up-to-date documentation and adhere to data privacy/security regulations (GDPR, etc.).

What You’ll Bring

  • Technical Mastery:
  • Proficient in Python/PySpark, SQL, and cloud technologies (Azure Databricks).
  • Hands-on experience with EDA, feature engineering, and model validation.
  • Solid grasp of mathematics and statistics, including hypothesis testing.
  • Skilled in Power BI, DAX, and dashboard optimization.
  • ML/AI Expertise:
  • Regression, classification, clustering, deep learning methods, and GenAI (Azure OpenAI).
  • Familiarity with scikit-learn, MLflow, TensorFlow/PyTorch.
  • Business Acumen & Communication:
  • Ability to convert complex findings into clear, actionable insights.
  • Comfortable presenting to stakeholders at all levels.

Education & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in a quantitative field.
  • 3+ years of data science experience in a large, complex environment.


Please note that this is a contract role for 6+ months and we require an office presence at our Schiphol HQ 3 days/week.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
The assignment is for the Passenger Information product team for Business Platform Commercial. As a Data Scientist, you will develop and maintain a number of products that are on the Commercial roadmap for the duration of the assignment.




The assignment consists of the following components:

Expanding our Customer Care LLM chatbot with functionalities to share real-time insights of flight information, baggage systems, and waiting times with passengers.
Setting up an API to summarize and categorize video conversations with passengers based on audio files.
Monitoring and maintaining our LLM chatbot, baggage predictions and security waiting time predictions.




Required experience:

5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist within a large (complex) organization, preferably semi-government
Knowledge of & experience with Python, Git, Machine Learning Frameworks, Generative AI, API Frameworks
Must be able to communicate in Dutch & English




For this assignment, work is also done at the client location in connection with coordination with relevant stakeholders. Work can also be done from home or another location, preferably in consultation with stakeholders. Preference is given to carrying out the assignment on Monday to Thursday due to stakeholders within the project who are present on these days.




ZZP or BV is allowed.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Ben jij een ervaren developer die een passie heeft voor AI? Solliciteer direct!

Join the journey

Wat ga je doen?

Als AI Engineer bij HSO ben je verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van AI-modellen in bedrijfsprocessen en- applicaties bij onze klanten. Je bent een technische expert met een scherp oog voor detail en een diepgaande kennis/passie van AI. Verder houdt de AI Engineer zich bezig met het:   

  • Ontwikkelen van prompt flows en integraties met systemen binnen de klantomgeving;
  • Samenwerken met het team en de klant om technische specificaties te definiëren en te documenteren;  
  • Testen en valideren van de geïmplementeerde modellen.


Over het team

In het gedreven en gezellige Data & AI team werk je samen met zo'n 50 consultants die uitblinken in Data Engineering, Data Analytics, AI en UX. Om je kennis te verbreden zijn er maandelijkse team meetings, expert sessies en is er alle ruimte voor het volgen van trainingen, conferenties en workshops.

Requirements

Wat breng jij mee?

  • Ruime ervaring in Machine Learning Engineering/AI Engineering;
  • Diepgaande kennis van python en/of C#;
  • Ervaring met prompt engineering & prompt flows in Large Language Models (LLM);
  • Jij kunt overweg met API's en SDKs om AI solutions effectief in te zetten (image processing, video processing, NLP processing, etc.);
  • Kennis en ervaring met Azure AI, ML Studio, Databricks en/of het OpenAI portfolio;
  • Een passie voor AI, je houdt actief je kennis bij en volgt ontwikkelingen in het veld;
  • Jij bent in staat om verantwoorde AI principes te begrijpen en toe te passen;
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift.


Benefits

Wat bieden we jou? 

Werken bij HSO is uitdagend, we willen je daar graag een goede beloning voor teruggeven. Naast goede primaire voordelen bieden wij: 

  • Een competitief salaris, een jaarlijkse bonus op basis van bedrijfs-, team- en individuele prestaties en een vast contract;
  • Mobiliteitsvergoeding waarbij je of een auto kunt leasen of het bedrag toe kunt voegen aan je salaris. Daar bovenop krijg je 100% betaald van de ov-kosten;
  • 25 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om er 35 van te maken; 
  • Hybride werken, vanuit huis, op kantoor (Rotterdam, Veenendaal) of zelfs tijdens je Workation; 
  • EUR 65,- netto vitaliteitsbudget - we vinden het belangrijk dat we gezond blijven en een veilige werkplek hebben, zowel op kantoor als remote; 
  • Je kunt deelnemen aan het leasefietsplan; 
  • En vooral een leven lang leren. Op dag één start jouw onboardingprogramma, daarnaast krijg je een persoonlijk studiebudget dat je kunt inzetten voor jouw professionele ontwikkeling en ontvang je ook een GoodHabitz account, een online trainingstool voor je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.  


Vrijheid, flexibiliteit en fun

Je werkt in een internationale omgeving met professionals met verschillende nationaliteiten. Een flexibele werkweek van 40, 36 of 32 uur behoort tot de mogelijkheden omdat wij van mening zijn dat jouw manier van werken bij jouw levensstijl moet passen. HSO heeft professionals in dienst die plezier hebben in hun werk en klaar staan voor elkaar. Om het plezier in ons werk nog groter te maken, organiseren we uiteraard teamuitjes en bedrijfsfeesten, maar ook wekelijkse zomerborrels op ons dakterras, allerlei sportactiviteiten en is er de mogelijkheid bij te dragen aan onze Maatschappelijk Verantwoord Ondernemen-werkzaamheden.

Over HSO  

HSO is de eerste full-service Microsoft Partner in Nederland. Samen met ruim 2500 getalenteerde medewerkers in Europa, Azië en Noord-Amerika verlenen we ondersteuning op lokaal en internationaal niveau aan industriële bedrijven, retailers, financiële en zakelijke dienstverleners en overheidsinstellingen. 

 

HSO is voortdurend op zoek naar nieuw talent. We blijven onze wereldwijde community uitbreiden en scheppen er plezier in om samen te werken met prestatiegerichte mensen met een ondernemersgeest. Professionals die voortdurend willen leren en innoveren. 

Solliciteren   

Enthousiast? Heb je vragen vooraf?  

Neem contact op met Micha Visser (Recruitment Business Partner) op mvisser@hso.com

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
My Client within the AI Powered Legal-Tech space located in Amsterdam are in search of an AI Software engineer who can successfully implement Generative AI into their Backend focused code-base.




Key Responsibilities:

Integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) (such as GPT-3, GPT-4, or other transformer-based models) into our backend systems using Node.js.
Collaborate with AI researchers and machine learning engineers to design, build, and scale generative AI and language models that can be deployed in production environments.
Develop efficient backend APIs and services to expose LLM capabilities (text generation, summarization, question-answering, etc.) to frontend applications.
Implement and optimize Generative AI algorithms (e.g., GPT, BERT, T5) to generate high-quality, relevant, and context-aware outputs in real-time.
Ensure scalability and performance optimization of AI-driven backend systems, with an emphasis on reducing latency and computational costs.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code following industry best practices for backend development in Node.js.
Contribute to model fine-tuning, ensuring the best performance of LLMs on specific tasks (e.g., customer support, content generation, natural language understanding).







Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Proven experience in integrating Generative AI models and Large Language Models (LLMs) into production environments.
Expertise in Node.js and backend development, with a strong understanding of server-side architectures and API design.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face) for model implementation and fine-tuning.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and understanding of asynchronous programming and RESTful APIs.
Experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes) for deploying AI-driven services.




Salary Package:

Up to €100,000
Flexible Hybrid working
Exciting Scale-up working environment
Travel Reimbursement
Show more

Title: Junior/Medior Data Scientist
HTML:
Het team Informatiemanagement maakt deel uit van BIS (Business Information Services) en bestaat uit een klein, hecht team van twee enthousiaste Business Intelligence-experts. De afgelopen jaren hebben we de transitie naar een modern Azure-dataplatform afgerond. Vele dashboards en rapportages ontwikkeld, en nu is het tijd om voorspellende modellen te creëren die de zorgprocessen verder optimaliseren.

Als Data Scientist in de zorg speel je een sleutelrol in het verbeteren van zorgprocessen door middel van data-analyse. Je duikt in grote hoeveelheden zorgdata om trends en patronen te ontdekken die inzicht geven in de kwaliteit en efficiëntie van de zorg. Op basis van deze analyses ontwikkel je voorspellende modellen en slimme algoritmes die helpen bij het maken van betere beslissingen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het vroegtijdig signaleren van gezondheidsrisico’s bij cliënten of het optimaliseren van planningen voor zorgpersoneel.

Jouw werk stopt niet bij de cijfers; je vertaalt complexe data naar begrijpelijke en praktische inzichten die direct toepasbaar zijn in de praktijk. Dit doe je door nauw samen te werken met zorgprofessionals, zoals artsen, verpleegkundigen en beleidsmakers, zodat jouw analyses daadwerkelijk bijdragen aan betere zorg. Je adviseert hen over hoe ze data-gedreven oplossingen kunnen inzetten om efficiënter te werken en de zorg voor cliënten te verbeteren.

Daarnaast presenteer je jouw bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan het management en andere afdelingen, zodat zij onderbouwde beslissingen kunnen nemen. Je werkt in een dynamische omgeving waarin technologie en zorg elkaar steeds meer versterken. Daarom blijf je continu op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen binnen datawetenschap en de zorgsector, zodat je innovatieve oplossingen kunt blijven ontwikkelen.

Met jouw expertise zorg je ervoor dat data niet alleen cijfers blijven, maar daadwerkelijk impact hebben op de dagelijkse zorgpraktijk. Dankzij jouw analyses en modellen kunnen zorginstellingen efficiënter werken en krijgen cliënten de zorg die het beste bij hen past.

  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in Data Science, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een vergelijkbare richting;
  • Kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python of R;
  • Ervaring met data-analysetools en visualisatietechnieken (zoals SQL en Power BI) is een pré;
  • Affiniteit met de zorgsector en de ambitie om maatschappelijke impact te maken;
  • Een nieuwsgierige, leergierige en communicatieve instelling die goed in een team past.
  • Je krijgt direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;
  • Dit contract is voor 36 uur per week;
  • Je kunt je werk afwisselen door zowel thuis of op kantoor (Leeuwarden of Drachten) te werken;
  • Salaris passend bij jouw kennis en ervaring. Het salaris varieert conform CAO VVT, FWG 55;
  • Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, pensioenopbouw en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%;
  • Vergoeding voor fitness, fiets, computer/tablet of een weekendje weg. Zodat je voldoende uitgerust weer aan het werk kunt;
  • Een goede werksfeer. Wij investeren in werkplezier!

Solliciteer

Direct enthousiast geworden? Solliciteer dan via de sollicitatiebutton, we vragen hierbij om je cv en motivatiebrief. Wil je eerst meer informatie over deze functie? Neem dan contact op met Peter Doorlag, Chief Information Officer, bereikbaar via 06-525047701, of Rein Kobus, Informatie Analist, bereikbaar via 06-10919982.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
At Sytac, we’re on a mission to become the leading name in digital solutions. We aim to help Dutch companies stay ahead with the latest technology. We’re not just another IT company; we’re a lively team of tech enthusiasts dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Our success comes from our amazing team—people who love technology and are dedicated to being the best in everything we do.




If you’re excited about leveraging your AI expertise to drive innovation and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!




We are looking for strong AI Platform Engineers with expertise in Azure, specifically in Azure AI services, Azure ML, Azure AI Foundry, Agentic frameworks, AI gateway for LLMs, and advanced RAG architecture (we already have vanilla RAG in place). Experience with Databricks Mosaic is highly desirable.




Your role will involve:

Designing, building, and testing the infrastructure of a central AI Platform on Azure using the latest AI and GenAI capabilities.
Ensuring a seamless operation and deployment of Azure AI services.
Designing, improving, and maintaining CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.
Integrating various tools and technologies in the DevOps toolchain to accelerate Data Science teams’ use cases from development to real-world applications.
Ensuring reliability and monitoring the usage, availability, and health of systems and products.
Identifying industry best practices and assessing the feasibility and benefits of implementing such practices.
Collaborating with various team members and teams to develop infrastructure that supports AI services.




Profile Description / Minimum Qualifications

Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience building, managing, supporting, and automating cloud environments (preferably in Azure).
Strong expertise in Azure AI services, Azure ML, Azure AI Foundry, AI Gateway for LLMs, RAG architectures (advanced RAG), and Databricks Mosaic.
Proficiency in IaC (Infrastructure as Code) and PaC (Policy as Code) (e.g., Bicep, Terraform).
Strong experience in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell).
Minimum 4 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, managing applications end-to-end in a cloud environment, including designing solutions, building, monitoring, and maintaining systems (preferably in Azure).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitLab, GitHub Actions—preferably Azure).
Awareness and familiarity with security and compliance standards for enterprise cloud adoption.
Determination and “stubbornness” to drive solutions and implement the right strategies.
Fluent in English (verbal and written).




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Data Science and Engineering tools from our tech stack (e.g., Databricks, Apache Spark, MLflow, Airflow).
Experience with monitoring tools for cloud environments.
Certifications in Azure-104, Azure-204, Azure-500 are a plus.

Title: AI engineer
Description:
Please note that we are only accepting candidates that live in or near the city of Amsterdam, The Netherlands. While we fully embrace remote work, we also value culture and connection - so our ideal candidate will be excited to come and join us at our studio at least once a week to share the energy and excitement of what we’re building together.

 

About Us

Huub is a platform that fully automates specific business processes by leveraging AI intelligently. We operate with a lean team of tech professionals and subject matter experts to develop and roll out these functionalities in the market. Are you looking for a place where you can work on concrete solutions for urgent problems while using bleeding-edge technology? Then Huub might be the right place for you.

 

Job Description

As an AI Engineer focusing on Prompt Engineering and Advanced AI Architecture, you will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and implementing AI solutions that enhance conversational and decision-making processes. You will improve AI-driven workflows by leveraging advanced AI agent architectures, efficient AI integrations, and prompt engineering.

You will work closely with other AI Engineers, platform architects, CI/CD teams, and UX specialists to ensure that our AI systems perform optimally, remain secure, and comply with best practices. You will contribute to the development of innovative methods to make AI interactions more effective, scalable, and intuitive.

 

Responsibilities

AI Architecture & Modeling

Integrate and optimize chat and reasoning models using LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith within AI workflows.
Design and develop AI agents with advanced context management and memory architectures.
Apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance information management.
Collaborate with infrastructure teams to build scalable and reliable AI solutions.

 

Prompt Engineering & Conversation Design

Develop and optimize prompts for various use cases within AI-driven processes.
Design and refine conversational flows and agent-based workflows within AI systems.
Implement safety guardrails and moderation strategies to ensure the reliability and ethical standards of AI interactions.

 

Requirements

Proven experience with cutting-edge AI technologies and methodologies.
A Master’s degree (WO) in AI, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in AI engineering, machine learning, or a similar technical role.
Experience in prompt engineering and conversation design for LLMs.
Deep knowledge of LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith.
Experience in designing robust AI agents and context-based workflows.
Understanding of AI ethics and moderation to build secure AI solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and a proactive mindset.




What We Offer

Huub operates as a lean tech startup, giving you the opportunity to build innovative AI solutions using cutting-edge technology. We offer a dynamic work environment where you have the freedom to develop your expertise and make an impact in a fast-growing AI ecosystem. We offer a competitive salary package with equity participation.




How to Apply

Send your CV and cover letter to vincent.lindeboom@huub.nl

Title: AI Specialist New
Description:
AI Specialist

Join CM.com as an AI Specialist! Leverage your AI expertise to connect teams, inspire innovation, and transform businesses with cutting-edge solutions.

Details

Location Amsterdam

Salary 3850 - 4500

Level Medior

Team Engage

About Us

Are you the bridge between AI technology and practical applications? Do you want to be in the absolute forefront of AI Development? Do you want to connect customers, product developers, and internal teams through your expertise in AI? Then we're looking for you! Be part of it and step into a role where you’ll be empowered to connect and drive change at CM.com.

Our ambition is to be an AI First company, meaning we don’t just use technology; we live it. CM.com is the place for innovators who share our enthusiasm for AI—whether they're powering up our products or transforming our own operations.

If you're passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we'd love to have you join our mission to change the way businesses and people connect.

You may already know us from those seamless SMS or WhatsApp messages you receive, the tickets you effortlessly grab for that upcoming festival, pay for anything with our payment solutions, or even through chatting with the helpful AI chatbot for support. All our services are integrated into our unique business structure, which consists of four business units: Connect, Pay, Live & Engage.

Since 1999, our philosophy has remained the same: “Do what you like, do what you’re good at, and contribute”.

What you will do

As an AI Specialist at our company, you play a crucial role in the success of our AI solutions. You're the expert who guides customers in effectively using our AI products, contributes to product development, and inspires colleagues with the possibilities of AI.

You will be mainly involved in two of our products: Inspire and HALO.

Inspire is the personalization AI Engine of CM.com. The AI personalization engine is designed to elevate customer engagement and foster meaningful relationships. CM.com's AI personalization engine provides a comprehensive suite of modules, each crafted to enhance your interaction strategies and deliver personalized experiences that resonate with your audience. Examples of the modules are for instance personal recommendations or predictive (re-)activation campaigns for our clients.

Besides personalization with AI, another CM product you will be broadly involved in is Halo. An advanced Agentic AI Platform that fundamentally transforms tasks and business processes. In recent years, organizations have gained experience with AI assistants that primarily work on a query basis (GenAI). The Agentic AI Platform HALO takes this a step further by offering proactive support that enables organizations to be ready for the future.

This role involves collaborating with colleagues and effectively guiding our clients in integrating AI into their businesses, meaning not every day is spent in the office. In addition to working from our offices in Tilburg, Breda, and Amsterdam, you will routinely visit our clients.

You Will, Amongst Others


Advise and educate customers on the possibilities and limitations of our AI products
Contribute to product development by improving market fit
Inspire and educate internal teams about AI
Analyze problems and opportunities related to AI implementations
Optimize and implement AI solutions across diverse sectors


You connect with us, if you

Feel connected to our Shared Values


Drive & Lead: We encourage the entrepreneurial spirit and are self-managed to be able to quickly grasp opportunities.
Grow & Learn: We keep evolving our innovation capabilities and help you to get the best out of yourself, both professionally and personally.
Together & Care: We love working together. We stimulate collaboration with utmost respect for each other regardless of gender, age, background, or beliefs.
Speed & Change: We are an agile and dynamic organization, that keeps adapting and knows how to respond to opportunities or change.


Additionally, You Have


Demonstrable knowledge and experience in applying AI concepts in practical situations
Multiple years of experience working in a setting similar to ours. You are able to communicate effectively and professionally with diverse stakeholders, including product teams, internal colleagues, and clients
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and solve complex problems
Data & technical skills: experience with programming, technical understanding of infrastructure (how API calls work are known to you), query capabilities, and interpreting results through dashboarding
Data Science knowledge: understanding of Generative AI (GenAI), Agentic AI, and Consumer AI
Fluency in English and Dutch
No problem with working from our offices in Tilburg, Breda, and Amsterdam or visiting the clients


Believe you’d be a great fit for this role, even if you don’t tick every box? Reach out to our Recruitment team! We’d be happy to connect and see if we can make it work together.

Benefits of working at CM.com

Your journey starts with the 3-day Global Onboarding at our Breda HQ. It's your fast track to CM.com awesomeness. Dive deep into our culture, connect with fellow game-changers, and get ready to join informative sessions, practical workshops, and great fun.

As a Club Member, you'll unlock a world of incredible benefits:


Fuel your mind: Daily healthy lunches and snacks to keep you energized.
Effortless commutes: Shuttle mobility cards and company cars get you where you need to be.
Invest in your future: A solid pension plan.
Take your time off: 25 vacation days with the option to buy 10 more to provide peace of mind.
Own your success: Become a shareholder with our Employee Share Purchase Program.
Level up your skills: Udemy, CM Academy, and exclusive Meetups with thought leaders to ensure you're always learning and growing.
Life's a party: Weekly drinks, board game nights, karaoke throwdowns, yearly ski trip, and more! We have something for everyone.


Here, diversity is our superpower. We celebrate every member, regardless of age, background, or beliefs.

You may already know us from those seamless SMS or WhatsApp messages you receive, the tickets you effortlessly grab for that upcoming festival, pay for anything with our payment solutions, or even through chatting with the helpful AI chatbot for support. Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Our customers have a growing need for meaningful data to make responsible decisions. Ipsos helps with this by finding out what motivates consumers and companies and by processing, analysing and reporting all the data collected. The Data Team focuses on data collection, data processing, data analysis, data science and data visualization.

Would you like to have a challenging role in the Data Team of one of the most innovative research agencies? Are you a data wizard who likes to get to the bottom of everything? Are you driven to work with the research teams to provide our clients with the right insights? Are you intelligent, self-employed? Then you are the reinforcement we are looking for in our Data Team.

Our organization

Ipsos employs professionals who have a natural intellectual curiosity. We have a passion for what drives people. For us, research is more than just information. We are always looking for new ways to work with our customers to find solutions that matter.

We work with wonderful customers and strong brands worldwide. As an organization, we are in full swing with a growing portfolio.

For our Data Team, we are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic

Data Scientist / Analyst

As a Data Scientist / Analyst at Ipsos, you will provide a valuable contribution to our clients' business by providing insights into consumer attitudes and behavior based on data from various sources.

The Following Activities Are Part Of Your Duties


Performing complex statistical analyses and prediction models for market research
Active participation in the research projects with advice, analysis and other support
Performing checks on the results before delivery to the research team
Unlocking research data, social media and customer data, structured and unstructured
Clear visualization and communication of the results to internal and/or external customers
Contribute to the renewal and improvement of existing structures and processes


Your qualities


Experience with databases, data analytics, data science and scripting on various platforms such as SQL, SPSS/SAS, R, Python, Git or similar packages.
A statistical background and affinity with research methods and techniques such as regression, segmentation, data fusion; Experience in survey research is an advantage
Academic working and thinking level.
Able to convey complex problems with simple words
Pragmatic, precise and creative. It's okay to be out-of-the-box


Your Skills


Skilled in learning software packages
Proactive, with an eye for detail
Flexible and able to handle deadlines well
Team player, with a drive to deliver results together
Good command of Dutch and English
Preferably available full-time, but at least 32 hours


What We Offer You


An international organization with many opportunities for personal growth and development.
A close-knit and diverse data team, the perfect mix of informal and professional, combining all facets of data collection and data processing
Strong and innovative research solutions to help our customers.
A working environment where there is plenty of room for your own input and fresh ideas. We appreciate it when you show character and make your voice heard.
A dynamic, open and informal working environment where everything revolves around our passion for customers and market research.
Collaboration with a driven group of colleagues who are known for their expertise, team spirit, intellectual curiosity and love for the profession.
An introduction program that ensures that you get off to a flying start and are settled in no time.
Regular drinks and inspiration sessions
A laptop, and with it the flexibility to work from home every now and then.


Have we piqued your interest?

Then we would like to get in touch with you. Send us your CV and cover letter (with a clear motivation why you are suitable for this role) by clicking on the application button. Preferably as soon as possible, but no later than April 7, 2025.

Do you have additional questions? Contact us at: recruitment.netherlands@ipsos.com .

For more information about Ipsos, visit www.ipsos.com/nl-nl

Follow us on LinkedIn: Ipsos-Netherlands

About Us

Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years . With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certification in 2022 & 2023!
Show more

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Job Description

We have an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic Bachelor or Master student who is interested in making a difference in Category Development at Kraft Heinz! The Category team is at the heart of our commercial activities and sets out and implements an effective category management our brands. This includes drafting commercial strategies, identifying brand & category opportunities and regular sparring sessions with the marketing, sales, finance, procurement, and other commercial teams. 

The Positions 

Every internship at Kraft Heinz Netherlands offers unique opportunities to develop new knowledge and skills, gain real business experience, get exposure to senior leadership and attend tailored trainings. As an intern you will take ownership of projects and work closely with the business on day-to-day challenges. 

Data scientist internship position in the KraftHeinz Advanced Analytics team. The position will focus on applying statistical and machine learning methodologies to answer challenging questions in the realm of revenue management and brand growth (pricing, promotion, assortment).

As part of KraftHeinz Digital, the intern will work on products used in markets across the globe – and tasks can range from operational check-ins with end-users to exploratory research.

Recruitment process  


CV selection based on eligibility requirements. 
Online Pymetrics assessment 
Online Pymetrics video interview 
Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams 
Online Hiring manager interview 



Note The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total 

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require an accommodation to participate in the job application or hiring process should contact NATAI@kraftheinz.com. 

What we offer you  

Program start date May 2025

Duration 6 months 

Allowance 625 euro per month (40hrs, 5 days) & full reimbursement of travel expenses 

Location Amsterdam 

Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online). 

Hybrid Policy  

Kraft Heinz has recently transitioned to a hybrid way of working, which means that we work 60% of the week in the office and have the right to work 40% from home. 

Location(s)

Amsterdam

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ITsPeople

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.




Role Overview

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Preparation: Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling: Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
Machine Learning and AI: Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Develop impactful visualizations and write comprehensive advisory reports to effectively communicate data insights and support informed decision-making.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.




Required Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 1-5 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python), ETL processes (SQL), and data processing with tools like Jupyter Notebook, Databricks, and Tableau. Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks and advanced statistics. Experience with MATLAB, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, or similar tools and modules is a plus.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
Language skills: Fluency in Dutch and English is required.




Personal Attributes

Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Detail Oriented: Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Proactive and Driven: Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
Team Player: Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
Personal Leadership: Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.




Training and Development

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.




Why Join ITsPeople?

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.




We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*** CONTRACT Machine Learning Engineer/Software Engineer ***

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands (remote)

Contract Length: 6 months + rolling contract

The Client:

A fast-growing tech scale-up developing AI-powered solutions to optimize renewable energy trading. Their technology helps energy companies manage power market fluctuations and maximize efficiency.




Responsibilities:

Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning pipelines for real-time and batch forecasting.
Automate ML model retraining and deployment for improved efficiency.
Optimize the scalability, reliability, and performance of AI-driven solutions.
Transform experimental ML code into production-ready software.
Implement best practices in CI/CD, DevOps, and performance monitoring.
Work with Python (ML/Data Stack), cloud platforms (GCP), Docker, Kubernetes, BigQuery, DBT, & monitoring tools




Requirements:

4+ years of experience in software development in an ML environment.
Strong experience with ML model life-cycle management (MLOps), preferably of time series models
Strong Python skills and ability to write clean, scalable code.
Experience with MLOps, CI/CD, DevOps, and software testing.
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS) and containerization.
BONUS: previous experience in energy or renewables sector

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Title: AI/ML Researcher
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

An AI/ML Researcher at TCS is responsible for advancing the field of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) through the design, development, and implementation of innovative algorithms and models. The role typically involves:




Responsibilities:

Research and Development:

Conduct cutting-edge research in AI and ML to advance state-of-the-art models and algorithms.
Explore and experiment with new machine learning techniques such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, and unsupervised learning.
Develop novel AI solutions for complex problems across various industries, including healthcare, finance, robotics, and autonomous systems.




Algorithm Design:

Design and implement novel algorithms for data analysis, predictive modeling, pattern recognition, and natural language processing.
Improve the efficiency and scalability of existing models and algorithms.




Data Analysis:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights for training models.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and key features that drive decision-making.




Model Training & Evaluation:

Train machine learning models on large datasets and optimize them for accuracy and performance.
Conduct thorough evaluation and testing of models using appropriate metrics to ensure generalizability and robustness.




Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to deploy AI/ML models into real-world applications.
Collaborate with other researchers and academic institutions to stay at the forefront of AI/ML trends and contribute to the academic community.




Publications & Presentations:

Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at industry conferences.
Communicate complex research results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Requirements:

Educational Qualifications:

A Ph.D. or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field with a strong focus on AI/ML.




Technical Skills:

Expertise in machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn).
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Strong knowledge of mathematical concepts, including linear algebra, probability, statistics, and optimization techniques.
Contributions to AI/ML open-source projects or publications in top-tier journals or conferences.
Experience in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for model deployment.
Familiarity with large-scale distributed systems and data processing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)




Experience:

Strong research background, deep technical expertise in AI and ML, and a passion for solving real-world problems with advanced technologies
Experience with deep learning, natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or reinforcement learning.
Practical experience in designing and deploying ML models at scale.




Soft Skills:

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to explain complex concepts clearly.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role
