Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description

Develop and maintain AI/ML solutions, including exploring large datasets, feature engineering, building data pipelines, testing and evaluating model outputs, and deploying solutions for production use in a scalable manner.

Design and develop the large-scale data infrastructure needed for AI/ML projects.

Contribute to architectural decisions and technical roadmaps while ensuring code quality, maintainability, and scalability.

Develop reusable components and frameworks that address common needs in AI/ML, such as model traceability, monitoring, versioning, and online/batch inference serving.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams including engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to build and enhance our AI ecosystem.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


A BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
5+ years of professional experience in relevant roles for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, with a strong focus on AI/ML development.
Strong software engineering background with hands-on experience in coding, DevOps, testing, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles, applied to AI/ML projects.
Proven experience developing and deploying software solutions to production in large-scale environments, ensuring product quality, cybersecurity, and performance.
Proficiency in modern programming languages, particularly Python (4+ years), with experience in back-end development and familiarity with FastAPI.
Expertise in cloud technologies, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Vertex AI, for cloud-based ML development.
Solid experience with MLOps practices, including developing ML pipelines and deploying applications to production.
A strong data science background with proficiency in various AI/ML techniques and frameworks.
Experience with high-volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), with expertise in SQL, DBT, and cloud data storage technologies.
Experience with requirement analysis, solution design, breaking down work into tasks, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure implementation of organizational standards and best practices.
Familiarity with agile working methodologies and a strong focus on data-driven development.


Application deadline: 30-03-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description

Develop AI/ML software products and solutions, including but not limited to explore large data set, feature engineering, data pipelines, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out for a maintainable solution in the comprehensive fashion network.

Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.

Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns contributing to architectural decisions, technical roadmap planning, technical documentation, and to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.

Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address both specific and common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B test, versioning, release, and serving of both online inference endpoints and batch inference.

Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Have a BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 5+ years’ professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a senior level Machine Learning Engineer, ideally with experience in supply chain and demand forecasting business and solutions.
A hands-on person, with great software engineering skills, who loves coding, and knows how to apply good software engineering practices, DevOps, testing and SRE principals - also to machine learning and AI projects.
Have extensive experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production and scaled in a bigger organization, also ensuring and fulfilling product quality, cybersecurity and performance requirements.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 4+ years, developing back-end services and preferably also using FastAPI.
Have great hands-on experience with cloud technologies for cloud solutions and ML development, ideally Google Cloud Platform, and also including Vertex AI.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, data pipelines and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a foundational data science background and a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling and developing for high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), preferably also including hands-on development in SQL and DBT, and have a solid understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality.
Have experience from aligning and analyzing requirement; driving design solutions; breaking down work into stories and tasks; communicating with stakeholders and supporting team members; and making sure organizational standards and best-practices are implemented and followed.
Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration and data-driven development.


Application deadline: 20-04-2025

Title: Recent Graduated Engineers - Your future challenge starts here!
Description:
Ready to find your path? Try new things. Share experiences. And discover what you truly enjoy.

Saab is growing across the country and is constantly looking for new talent! If you are at the end of your studies or at the beginning of your career and want to continue developing while working to keep people and society safe, you are warmly welcome to apply to us.

Your role

With us, learning is everywhere. A place where each day is a chance to discover something new, share what you know and learn from others. Here, you´ll get inspired by a bunch of smart and experienced people. Ready to dive in? You can explore different areas, find a new passion, and figure out your own path. Plus, we got plenty of courses and training to help you level up your skills. Grow with us, every step of the way.

Saab offers diverse roles and continuous learning opportunities within IT, software development, systems engineering, electronics and mechanical engineering, just to mention a few. Start your journey as an engineer with us and play a key role in developing cutting-edge defense and security systems.

There are several ways to work at Saab as a recent graduate, in a team as a junior engineer or through different introductory and trainee programs.

Your profile

To be a successful employee at Saab, we want you to be a curious person who thrives in a supportive and friendly workplace where teamwork is the core to find smart solutions. You should be in the final stages of your post-secondary studies or a recent graduate.

We believe that you have a Bachelor´s or Master´s degree within one of the following fields:


Information Technology/System Science
Computer Science
Engineering Physics
Electrical Engineering
Mechatronics
Mechanical Engineering



Whether you’re passionate about creating secure and robust systems, developing innovative electrical or mechanical solutions, or engage in complex problem solving, we offer varied roles to match your skills and interest.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

What You Will Be Part Of

Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.

Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.

Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.

Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

Does this sound like something you want to hear more about? Submit your application today!

If you are interested in introductory and trainee programs, write a note about it in the application questionnaire. Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Leverage the power of machine learning to revolutionize sustainable shopping for millions of customers.

"We value your ideas and curiosity since they are key enablers to keep up with the ever-changing machine learning field." - Therese, Head of Machine Learning.

Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and who are ready to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.

Machine Learning at Sellpy

We look for you who want to be part of our journey to make sustainable shopping the first-hand choice by building great product recommendations, using computer vision to make the item handling process smoother and other user-friendly solutions. We want to provide the best customer experience and that’s why we need you on board.

This job will suit you if you’re excited to build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning models and build custom models to solve unique challenges together with a team of highly motivated engineers.

In short, you will


Build machine learning models with a major impact on our product
Simplify, build and improve our already existing models
Build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning development
Enjoy personal growth during our level-up days once a month
Keep up with ML development with the team on weekly deep dives
Make use of your skills in Tensorflow and Python


Requirements


B.S or M.S. degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong proficiency in Python
Experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch
Experience with AWS or similar cloud service providers
Written and spoken fluency in English


We’d be impressed if you have


Previous experience with recommender systems
Knowledge about how to build efficient data pipelines
Experience in setting up ML systems in production
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL


You’ll get to


Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges on a daily basis.
Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, and from home.
Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform
Spend time on personal development during monthly level-up days.
Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
Save up with a monthly pension plan.
Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.


Location

You are welcome to do all these things at our office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.

Form of employment: Full-time

Start: As agreed upon

Öppen för alla Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
About the Job

Want to be part of building the future of Sales for companies everywhere? Where AI Meets Human Communication!




Our client is spearheading a revolution in Sales by empowering sales agents to excel through automated personalized coaching powered by advanced AI technology.




They are on a mission to shape the future of sales for businesses globally, and are looking for talented individuals to join their amazing team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, designers, and more in their Stockholm office.




The company is transforming sales professionals' lives worldwide—building more connected and efficient teams at the intersection of behavioural science and automation.




The state-of-the-art AI technology is redefining how sales professionals learn to communicate with confidence and precision in every interaction. Monitoring everything down to the customer’s tone of voice, picking up buying signals and offering live advice to agents and managers.




The team previously built and held leadership roles at industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana and EF. We’re now building a new category leader in AI, solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally.




They are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and are backed by a global group of prominent and heavy-hitting tech entrepreneurs and investors.




Role and Challenges 🚀

Design and develop machine learning models to extract insights, predict sales outcomes, and optimize coaching recommendations.
Work with large-scale data sets, ensuring data integrity, feature engineering, and preprocessing pipelines.
Collaborate closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate AI-driven solutions into our core platform.
Deploy and optimize models in production, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
Analyze model performance, troubleshoot issues, and iterate on improvements to maximize impact.
Contribute to research and development efforts to push the boundaries of AI in sales automation.
Stay current with industry trends in AI, data science, and machine learning, proposing innovative solutions to enhance our product offerings.




What We're Looking For 🤩

Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with expertise in AI-driven applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP for deploying and managing ML models.
Experience in handling and analyzing large datasets, developing data pipelines, and implementing feature engineering techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business challenges into data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with NLP, time-series forecasting, or recommender systems is a plus.
Experience in mentoring junior data scientists or leading projects is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional team.
A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.




What’s On Offer? 👀

Competitive salary & equity package
Mobile phone reimbursement
Six weeks annual paid vacation
Wellness budget
Learning & development budget




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description




TheAlgoCave is a consulting firm specialising in digital transformation and innovation, helping organisations leverage data for business and technology integration. The company prioritises delivering commercial value from data products and guiding clients through every step of the data journey with industry and academic expertise.




Role Description

We are looking for an experienced ML engineer to help support a new business unit (startup within the Energy tech). It is a remote contract role but could also consider a full-time position for the right candidate. Below are the few responsibilities for this profile.




Perform data analysis and frame ML problem statements from business requirements.
Perform time-series analysis and develop forecasting models.
Develop and implement mathematical optimisation solutions.
Develop anomaly detection, predictive maintenance tools and other advanced ML/AI solutions.
Deploy solutions to cloud infrastructure for near real-time predictions. (MLOps)




Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of industry experience with hands-on ML solution development.
Strong background in Statistics.
Experience with deep learning solutions for time series problems. (RL is a plus)
Experience with deploying models in cloud infrastructure.
Phthon, PyTorch & GCP/AWS.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.




Unfortunately, we do not offer sponsorship for this role.

The candidate must reside in Sweden.

Start ASAP.

Title: Scientist
Description:
Overview

My client is a pioneering Swedish biotech company focused on immunotherapy medicines including rare disease, vaccines and cancer who are seeking a passionate, dedicated Scientist to join our dynamic team in Stockholm. Structured around a strong business model and ambitious senior management team, my client is look for a self-proclaimed "lab rat" who thrives on generating data and enjoys generating data. You will become an integral part of a specialized 5-scientist team working toward groundbreaking RNA therapeutics. Over the next 18 months, you will play a crucial role as part of the team in identifying lead candidates before progressing toward IND filing and clinical trials. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge research that has the potential to transform patient outcomes in rare diseases. There is potential based on positive results in the next months that the team will double in size before the end of the year, so a great opportunity for an enthusiastic scientist to join an ambitious and expanding team with good career progression opportunity through organic growth.




Requirements

The ideal candidate will possess:

MSc in Immunology, Molecular Biology, or related life sciences field
Experience working with rare disease models in vivo
Proficiency in classical scientific lab techniques including:
Western blotting and other protein analysis methods
Cell culture and manipulation of immune cells, particularly T cells
RNA isolation, characterization, and modification techniques
PCR, qPCR, and other nucleic acid analysis methods
Experience with mouse models and downstream analysis
Experience collaborating with CROs on preclinical studies
Knowledge of NHP models would be highly advantageous
Strong background in immunology, especially T cell biology
Experience in biotech environment preferred
Excellent documentation skills and ability to design and execute experiments independently
Proven track record of delivering results in a fast-paced research environment




Cultural Fit




My client values scientists who embrace challenges and take quick, responsive action to scientific obstacles. The ideal team member is someone who approaches hypothesis generation and experimental design with creativity and enthusiasm. They are looking for curious, hungry scientists who aren't afraid to roll up their sleeves and perform mission-critical work—whether that means running 10 Western blots in a row or tackling other intensive laboratory tasks to generate the necessary data (hypothetically speaking, it’s all about drive and passion for problem solving).




The successful candidate will demonstrate resilience, adaptability, and a genuine passion for advancing immunological therapeutics. You should be comfortable in a fast-paced environment where priorities may shift as the science evolves.




References will be required for this role and the interview process will include a technical assessment, cultural fit and senior leadership discussion.
This is a lab-based role.
This role comes with a competitive remuneration policy based on experience.
The interview process is expected to be 3 stages based on internal/external availability.

Title: Data Scientist till Data och Analys
Description:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ!




Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.




SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.

Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.







Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:




Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion




Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.




Förväntningar på den vi söker

En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll







Ansökan och information

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.




Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 15 mars 2025.







Om SJ AB

SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.

Show more

Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.



Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:


  • Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
  • Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
  • Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
  • Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
  • Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion


Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.


Förväntningar på den vi söker

  • En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
  • Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
  • Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
  • Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
  • En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
  • Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
  • Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
  • Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll



Ansökan och information

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.


Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 15 mars 2025.



Om SJ AB

SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.

Title: Machine Learning engineer
Description:
At Professional Galaxy AB, we combine innovative technology with strategic business insights to drive growth and optimize operations. Our expert team provides tailored IT solutions and consultancy services designed to streamline your processes and elevate your competitive edge.


Innovative recruitment agency based in Sweden.
Assisting companies in recruiting the right talent at the right time, minimizing costs.
Submitting qualified candidates based on daily requirements.


Job Description

The primary tasks as a Machine Learning Engineer are:


Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company.
Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.


Required Skills And Experiences


Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 4+ years professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
Familiar with agile ways of working team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.


Remote: 50%

Assignment Period: 2024.10.21 - 2025.03.31

Submission deadline: 2024-10-20

Title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar och driva innovation inom avancerad analys? Vi söker nu en Data Scientist som vill ta en central roll i att utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion.

Om jobbet

Som en del av vårt dynamiska team kommer du att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella grupper för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa lösningar grundade i data och avancerad analys. Du får möjligheten att visualisera och kommunicera insikter på ett sätt som gör skillnad, samtidigt som du coachar och vägleder kollegor inom maskininlärning och AI. Vi befinner oss i en spännande fas där AI spelar en allt större roll i vår verksamhet, och vi behöver dig för att ta våra lösningar till nästa nivå!

Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


Utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion
Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa data-drivna lösningar
Visualisera och kommunicera insikter och analysresultat på ett tydligt sätt för olika intressenter
Vägleda och coacha kollegor Inom maskininlärning och AI samt förbättra utvecklingsprocesser
Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom AI och aktivt tillämpa nya insikter


Vem är du?

För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har en stark analytisk förmåga, är nyfiken och har ett brinnande intresse för AI, data och maskininlärning. Du trivs i en innovativ miljö där vi testar oss fram och bygger lösningar från grunden.

För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:


Erfarenhet av att sätta maskininlärningsmodeller i produktion samt av hela livscykeln; idé/experiment, produktionssättning, underhåll och monitorering
Gedigen kunskap i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av försäkringsbranschen och förståelse för affären
Erfarenhet av MLOps och ETL-processer
En relevant utbildning inom Datateknik, Data Science, Matematik eller liknande


Det är även meriterande om du har:


Erfarenhet av MLFlow, Docker och molnbaserade lösningar (gärna Azure)
Förmåga att leda projekt inom AI och Data Science
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med API:er och strömmande data


Om oss

Välkommen till Sak på Länsförsäkringar AB, vi stolta över att vara i centrum av vår teknologiska utveckling. Vi levererar innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt och säkerställer att vi alltid ligger steget före. Vårt team av dedikerade experter arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket möjliggör för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder. Vi är här för att göra skillnad, varje dag.

Vi är ett innovativt team på 14 personer som brinner för samarbete, kunskapsdelning och ny teknik. Majoriteten är data scientists, men teamet växer med AI Engineers, arkitekter och DevOps- Engineers. Vi leder AI-utvecklingen inom Länsförsäkring AB och skapar lösningar som gör skillnad. Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i en spännande resa där vi formar framtidens AI – vill du vara med? Sök idag!

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28
Show more

Title: Älskar du Python & Django? Ansök via SSH!
Description:
Vill du jobba med Python och Django? Älskar du open source? Då vill vi gärna jobba med dig.

Ansök direkt i terminalen genom att SSH:a till join.5monkeys.se!

Från våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och från våra distanskontor (remote!) tar vi fram storskaliga digitala tjänster åt våra kunder.

Vi har utvecklat några av Sveriges allra största Python/Django-baserade digitala tjänster. Genom att all utveckling sker tillsammans i team kan vi upprätthålla en mycket hög gemensam kunskaps- och kvalitetsnivå där vi lär oss av varandra.

Vi gillar modern testdriven utveckling med byggstenar såsom Docker, CI-verktyg och hög coverage.

Vi bidrar aktivt till flera open source-projekt. Du hittar några av våra projekt på GitHub: https://github.com/5monkeys

Du ansöker enklast direkt i terminalen genom att SSH:a till join.5monkeys.se. Välkommen!

Title: Staff Data Scientist (New Verticals)
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About The New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we’re looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you’ll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We’re looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You’ll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Out humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About The New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we’re looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you’ll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We’re looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You’ll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you

  • The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
  • You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.

Out humble expectations

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
  • Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
  • Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
  • Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
  • Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.

Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?

Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.

Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.

Key Responsibilities


Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.



Who You Are

We expect you to have:


Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.



Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.

Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Om tjänsten

Som AI Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa och utveckla AI-lösningar baserade på verksamhetens krav.

Du blir en del av Cloud Platform-teamet, som hanterar AI-lösningar främst i det publika molnet. Här kommer du att stötta och guida våra utvecklingsteam och verksamheten med din expertis inom AI. Teamet strävar efter ständig förbättring, och du kommer att ha stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.

Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:



Designa, utveckla och driftsätta gen-AI drivna applikationer och lösningar.
Samarbeta med olika intressenter för att förstå verksamhetens behov.
Stödja utvecklingsteam och verksamheten med AI-drivna lösningar.
Utveckla och upprätthålla AI-verktyg och infrastruktur.
Utvärdera effektiviteten av gen-AI drivna applikationer.
Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste framstegen inom AI och maskininlärning.
Förklara komplexa tekniska idéer för icke-tekniska intressenter.


Vem vi sökerVi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:



Gedigen erfarenhet av arbete med Azure-tjänster, särskilt inom AI.
Gedigen kunskap om Generativ AI.
Stark programmeringsförmåga i språk som Python & .NET.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-kultur och med verktyg som AzureDevOps och GitHub.
Högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, teknik, matematik eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Goda kunskaper i svenska OCH engelska.


Det är meriterande om du även:



Är certifierad inom AI.
Har praktisk erfarenhet av AI Assistenter.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med vektordatabaser och retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure AI Studio för utveckling av AI-lösningar.
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt.


Vi erbjuder

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i framkanten av AI-teknologi och vara en del av vår spännande resa mot att bli ett ännu mer datadrivet och AI-fokuserat företag. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för vår framgång.

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning.

Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Ansök nu och var med och forma framtiden för AI i vår organisation!

Övrigt

Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjlig.

I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Om du uppfyller grundkraven hos oss kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig och även mer information om dessa, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos Alva Labs .

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Carlos Cederfeldt (carlos cederfeldt@nltg.com).

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".

Arbetsområde

IT

Roll: Technology Services

Platser: Stockholm

Distansarbete: Hybridarbete

Anställningsform: Heltid

Startdatum

Enligt överenskommelse

Kontaktperson: Carlos Cederfeldt (carlos.cederfeldt@nltg.com)
Show more

Title: Data Scientist II - Client Platform
Description:
The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the frameworks, capabilities and tools needed to welcome a billion customers. Join us and help to amplify productivity, quality and innovation across Spotify.

We are an insights team supporting across the domains of Developer Experience, Client Platform and Core Infrastructure. As a member of the team, you’ll work closely with a cross functional team of data scientists, data engineers, user researchers, and product managers who are all passionate about creating scalable products for our developers and customers. Your focus will be in the Client Platform domain which strives to bring a great experience for client developers at Spotify, and through this deliver stable and reliable products for people to enjoy.

What You’ll Do


Work closely with cross-functional teams of skilled engineers, data scientists, user researchers, designers, and product managers who are all passionate about providing an outstanding product experience
Define metrics, build dashboards and create reports and key datasets to empower data-informed product development
Perform exploratory analysis to understand who our users are, how they get value out of our offering and where we can further develop our product to bring greater value
Communicate insights and recommendations to key partners, helping activate data best practices


Who You Are


You have a 4+ years work experience with an emphasis on programmatic data analysis, reporting, and visualization/ dashboarding with Tableau or similar BI solution
You have proven experience using coding skills such as Python, SQL and/or R to analyze complex data
You have experience or a strong interest in internal tooling and highly complex technical domains such as cloud infrastructure, continuous integration, observability, and software architecture.
You are curious and not afraid of exploring new domains; you enjoy partnering with others to define and develop new opportunities
You are able to communicate technical information clearly and concisely.


Where You´ll Be


This role is based in London or Stockholm.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vi söker en driven och kunnig Data Scientist eller Machine Learning Engineer till vårt Recommendation Engine-team på ICA Sverige. I denna roll kommer du att analysera och tolka stora mängder data samt designa, bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller för att lösa affärsutmaningar. Du kommer att arbeta med att implementera och optimera data pipelines för att säkerställa effektiv drift och nyttjande av driftsatta modeller. Dessutom kommer du att visualisera och presentera insikter för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.

Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker dig som har relevant erfarenhet med en kombination av maskininlärning, data science och data engineering med stark matematisk kompetens. Du bör ha minst 3 års erfarenhet av dataanalys och att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller. Stark programmeringskunskap, helst i Python, och erfarenhet av att bearbeta data med SQL är ett krav. Erfarenhet av att arbeta på en Cloud-plattform, helst GCP, är meriterande.

Därför ska du välja ICA

Hos ICA får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där du kan utvecklas och växa. Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att spegla våra kunder och samhället. Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsplats och möjligheten att arbeta med spännande projekt som gör skillnad. I denna roll kommer du att samarbeta nära med kollegor inom Customer Solutions, Försäljning och Marknad för att skapa värdefulla lösningar för våra kunder.

Vad händer nu?

Ansök så snart som möjligt men senast 1 april, vi gör löpande urval. För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Markus Koppari på 072-2202831.

Om ICA

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.
Show more

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Utveckla framtiden med oss

Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.




Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?

I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.

Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!




För den här tjänsten tror vi även att du:

har minst tre års erfarenhet av programmering i Java, C#/.NET eller liknande
arbetar kvalitetsinriktat och känner dig bekväm med såväl testdriven utveckling som automatiserade tester
har kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
behärskar svenska i tal och skrift




Om oss

Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.




Vi satsar på dig

På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.




Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.




Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.




Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

Show more
HTML:
Utveckla framtiden med oss

Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.


Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?

I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.

Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!

  • har kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
  • eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
  • har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
  • har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
  • behärskar svenska i tal och skrift


Om oss

Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.


Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.


Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

Title: AI Applied Engineer
Description:
About Lovable...




We’re Lovable: a small, ambitious crew of serial founders, physicists, competitive programmers, and product engineers.

Our goal? Be the first to make autonomous code generation work.

We’re pioneering a new way for anyone to create and maintain web apps using plain English. Combining LLMs + novel UX + clever algorithms, we’re building a bridge between coders and non-coders.




The role: AI Applied Engineer




You’ll be at the cutting edge of autonomous coding, ensuring that our product is robust, reliable, and continually pushing the frontier of what’s possible.

Your mission is to identify the biggest challenges impacting reliability—and come up with inventive, creative solutions. This isn’t just about making things work; it’s about making them unfailingly excellent and scalable.




What you’ll do:




Push the Limits: Identify bottlenecks and failure points in our code generation pipeline and devise ingenious ways to overcome them.
Innovate & Iterate: Experiment with state-of-the-art reliability techniques for LLMs and autonomous agents.
Rapid Debugging: Pinpoint and resolve complex reliability issues with speed and precision.
Data-Driven Improvements: Analyze reliability patterns, run failure analyses, and implement strategies to boost accuracy and performance.
Dogfood to the Max: Rigorously use our own product for internal development, pushing it to the limit in real-world scenarios, surface edge cases, break things (on purpose), and refine the product from the inside out.




What we’re looking for:




Full-Stack Proficiency: Experience working with full-stack applications, preferably using React on the frontend.
Experience with LLMs: Practical experience working with LLMs and their quirks.
Inventive Problem-Solving: You see challenges as puzzles waiting to be cracked, and you bring unconventional ideas to the table.
Fast Debugger: You can quickly identify, analyze, and fix complex AI Applied issues.
Bias for Action: You move fast, experiment, and iterate; shipping solutions is in your DNA.
Curiosity for the Cutting Edge: You stay up-to-date with the latest research and apply it pragmatically.
Strong Communication: Ability to clearly explain reliability challenges, solutions, and trade-offs to both technical and non-technical teammates.




Why Lovable?




Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis




If you’re ready to help build the last piece of software—we want to hear from you. Let’s make something Lovable.




About your application:




Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system.
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you. Hit apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.
Show more

We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
We have partnered with a one of the largest banks within Scandinavia to assist with scaling a small team of software developers currently working on an internal trading platform. This team works along side traders to create a variety of tools assisting with position execution.




The role:




The client is a market leader in the trading space and is currently looking for senior backend developers to join and spearhead future developement. They are looking for driven individuals who are open to push the morn and build world class products.







8 Years + of experience in Software development
Highly experienced within .Net / C#
Strong experience within Cloud technologies (Azure)
Experience within Docker / Kubernetes







We offer




We offer a dynamic working environment in the heart of Stockholm that focuses on allowing developers to develop. The current team works to a hybrid model and regularly enjoys team socials and collaborative work.




Benefits Offered:

30 days holiday
ITP1 Pension
Education allowance
Wellness allowance




Unfortunately this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship.




If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch




tim.stokes@parallelconsulting.com

+46 85 502 486 58

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Consumer, Payments)
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Consumer Analytics At Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Payments Domain

Payment Group at Wolt is building a world-class payment infrastructure for the best customer experience. You’ll be part of the team working on a smooth, scalable, and secure checkout experience adapting to the many use cases of consumers.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Payments, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience with the Payments domain - we’ll pay lots of attention to this experience.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more
