Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Har du flera års erfarenhet och teknisk kompetens inom Data Science-projekt? Vi söker dig som är en passionerad och erfaren Data Scientist, där du blir en del av vårt satsningsområde där målsättningen är att bli ledande. Våra kunder har ett stort behov av automatisering genom intelligent automation och dataanalys, och vi behöver din expertis! Vill du forma framtidens digitala samhälle och ständigt utvecklas? Då har vi utmaningen för dig!

Din roll på Atea

Våra kunder genomgår en digital förändringsresa där du som Data Scientist kommer att ha en nyckelroll. I rollen som Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med allt från externa faktorer, programmering, dataanalys, API:er, backend och leverans, till att leda projekt och säkerställa hög prestanda i skala.

Som konsult på Atea är du en drivkraft bakom din egen, Ateas och våra kunders framgång. Konsultrollen erbjuder spännande och utmanande uppdrag, på egen hand eller i team med andra kollegor. Du får möjlighet att möta nya människor och kontexter där du ansvarar för att driva innovativa projekt framåt, bidra med din expertis och identifierar nya möjligheter där både du och Atea kan skapa värde för våra kunder.

Du kommer att vara en del av vårt affärsområde Information Management som omfattar strategi, arkitektur, information & data analytics (AI, BI, RPA och IoT), verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, it-styrning, projektledning samt informations- och cybersäkerhet.

Rollen som Data Scientist på Atea erbjuder:


Möjlighet att leda och driva spännande data science-projekt
En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din goda affärsförståelse och starka kommunikationsförmåga, både internt och externt, kommer till sin rätt
En plattform för att utveckla dina interpersonella färdigheter och optimera prestanda genom kod- och dataflödesoptimeringar



Ditt team

Christian Hedén, Konsultchef på Atea, kommer att vara din närmste chef i rollen. Du kommer ingå ett närmsta team på åtta drivna och ansvarstagande kollegor som jobbar tätt tillsammans och alltid ställer upp för varandra. Du kommer även jobba tätt med andra team inom området nationellt på Atea. Inom teamet är det högt i tak och prestigelöst och vi har en bred kunskap som består av både juniora och seniora personer.

Vem är du?

Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas hos oss. Du är drivande och resultatinriktad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad med lätt för att anpassa dig till nya förhållanden. Du är kommunikativ, skapar goda relationer och har ett affärsmässigt fokus där du förstår innebörden att leverera hög klass på service mot våra kunder. Med god erfarenhet är du självgående inom området och du strävar efter att utvecklas inom området.

För rollen som Data Scientist ser vi att du har med dig:


Flertalet års erfarenhet av liknande roll med hög kompetensnivå inom statistisk modellering
Djup förståelse för relationer mellan verkliga faktorer, modellparametrar och tolkningar av modellresultat
Stark affärsförståelse och förmåga att skala upp prestanda, både internt och externt
Mycket goda kunskaper i Python
Erfarenhet av Machine Learning
Obehindrad i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande



Har vi väckt ditt intresse?

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christian Hedén, Konsultchef, via christian.heden@atea.se. Har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Annie Davnert, Talent Acquisition Partner, via annie.davnert@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!

Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.

Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.



Följ oss i sociala medier



 


Show more

I rollen som Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med allt från externa faktorer, programmering, dataanalys, API:er, backend och leverans, till att leda projekt och säkerställa hög prestanda i skala.

Som konsult på Atea är du en drivkraft bakom din egen, Ateas och våra kunders framgång. Konsultrollen erbjuder spännande och utmanande uppdrag, på egen hand eller i team med andra kollegor. Du får möjlighet att möta nya människor och kontexter där du ansvarar för att driva innovativa projekt framåt, bidra med din expertis och identifierar nya möjligheter där både du och Atea kan skapa värde för våra kunder.

Du kommer att vara en del av vårt affärsområde Information Management som omfattar strategi, arkitektur, information & data analytics (AI, BI, RPA och IoT), verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, it-styrning, projektledning samt informations- och cybersäkerhet.

Rollen som Data Scientist på Atea erbjuder:

  • Möjlighet att leda och driva spännande data science-projekt
  • En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din goda affärsförståelse och starka kommunikationsförmåga, både internt och externt, kommer till sin rätt
  • En plattform för att utveckla dina interpersonella färdigheter och optimera prestanda genom kod- och dataflödesoptimeringar


Ditt team

Christian Hedén, Konsultchef på Atea, kommer att vara din närmste chef i rollen. Du kommer ingå ett närmsta team på åtta drivna och ansvarstagande kollegor som jobbar tätt tillsammans och alltid ställer upp för varandra. Du kommer även jobba tätt med andra team inom området nationellt på Atea. Inom teamet är det högt i tak och prestigelöst och vi har en bred kunskap som består av både juniora och seniora personer.

Vem är du?

Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas hos oss. Du är drivande och resultatinriktad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad med lätt för att anpassa dig till nya förhållanden. Du är kommunikativ, skapar goda relationer och har ett affärsmässigt fokus där du förstår innebörden att leverera hög klass på service mot våra kunder. Med god erfarenhet är du självgående inom området och du strävar efter att utvecklas inom området.

För rollen som Data Scientist ser vi att du har med dig:

  • Flertalet års erfarenhet av liknande roll med hög kompetensnivå inom statistisk modellering
  • Djup förståelse för relationer mellan verkliga faktorer, modellparametrar och tolkningar av modellresultat
  • Stark affärsförståelse och förmåga att skala upp prestanda, både internt och externt
  • Mycket goda kunskaper i Python
  • Erfarenhet av Machine Learning
  • Obehindrad i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
  • Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande


Har vi väckt ditt intresse?

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christian Hedén, Konsultchef, via christian.heden@atea.se. Har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Annie Davnert, Talent Acquisition Partner, via annie.davnert@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!

Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.

Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.

Följ oss i sociala medier

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data domain

The Data domain is part of the Product and Tech function with the mission of transforming Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our Machine Learning team. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work on building and deploying machine learning models that will help drive and automate critical business decisions within our product services. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ML applications, collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, and take ownership of end-to-end machine learning lifecycles. If you're passionate about ML and AI, problem-solving, and building scalable solutions, we’d love to have you on board.




What you’ll do
Model Development & Optimization: Develop end-to-end pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production environments and continuously improve model performance through feature selection, hyperparameter tuning and model lifecycle management
Data Pipeline Design & Management: Build and maintain efficient data pipelines for data collection, preprocessing, and feature transformation to ensure high-quality near real-time input for ML models
Performance Monitoring: Monitor and evaluate feature drift and the performance of deployed models, ensuring they meet business requirements and adjusting as necessary to maintain a high level of model performance over time
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects and product managers to understand the business needs and translate them into scalable machine learning products
Stay Ahead of Trends: Keep up with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies, applying new methodologies and tools to enhance the effectiveness of your work





Who you are
Experience: You have 5+ years of hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment with near real-time latency
Education: You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

Technical Skills:
Proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, or C++
Experience with ML frameworks such as Sagemaker, MLFlow, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch and similar frameworks
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistics, and optimization techniques
Experience working with ML Operations, model lifecycle, infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines for model deployment
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, and deploying ML models at scale in said platforms
Experience with big data tools and distributed computing (e.g., Spark, Apache Beam/Flink)
Experience working with streaming data pipelines in Kafka (or similar)
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker)
Experience within open banking is a plus but not required








Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Perception Software Engineer
Description:
Company

Qualcomm Auto Ltd Sweden Filial

Job Area

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering

General Summary

Are you passionate about advancing ADAS and Autonomous Driving systems? Imagine contributing to a safer world while collaborating with brilliant, creative, and enjoyable colleagues. Dive into exciting and challenging technology—apply today for this rewarding opportunity!

We are Perception within Qualcomm Automotive

Qualcomm is an American multinational corporation known for our creation of semiconductors, software, and services related to wireless technology.

Our Perception organization belong to the Automotive branch delivering the Snapdragon Digital Chassis - a set of cloud-connected platforms for telematics and connectivity, digital cockpit, and driver assistance and autonomy.

As a Perception Software Engineer at Qualcomm Automotive, you will design, develop, create, modify and validate state-of-the-art computer vision software for autonomous driving and advanced driver assistance systems. You will be part of Requirement Area Spatial Awareness, working closely with experts in different areas within computer vision. You will have the opportunity to contribute with your expertise as well as learn from other highly skilled developers. Together you develop algorithms for Detection of Freespace, i.e. Drivable area for the vehicle, enabling autonomous braking, adaptive cruise control and high-level autonomy.

As a member of one of our cross functional teams, you will be performing tasks covering all parts of the product development cycle, including software design, machine learning, hands on work with data, testing, writing requirements and functional safety.

Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.



OR

Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.


2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.



As a person, we are looking for you who have a drive and “can do”-attitude, as well as the willingness to learn and expand your skillset in new areas. We also believe you are highly motivated and a pragmatic problem solver. Preferably, you also have previous experience from leadership positions as Team Lead or Tech Lead.

We are looking for someone who matches at least 2-3 of the descriptions below:


Software Development: You have a robust software development background, preferably complemented by expertise in system design and architecture (required).
Language and Tools: Proficiency in languages and tools for machine learning and SW development, particularly and C/C++, python and tensorflow.
Machine Learning: You bring practical experience in machine learning development, gained from relevant industry contexts. This includes practical experience of working with and developing the datasets used.
Computer Vision: You have experience from applying algorithms to solve complex problems within Computer Vision.



Preferred Qualification


Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering Physics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field.
8+ years of Software Engineering, Computer Vision, Machine learning and/or related work experience.
1+ years in leadership position (Team Lead, Tech Lead, Project Lead or similar)
References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.



Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).

Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se
Show more
HTML:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:

  • Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
  • Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
  • Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
  • Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
  • Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
  • Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
  • Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:

  • Generös kompetensutveckling
  • Attraktiv lönemodell
  • En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning

Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se

Title: Applied Ai Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Applied AI Engineer, you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.

Role

Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:


Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


What You Need To Embark

To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:


Software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
Experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
Curiosity and pragmatism – you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo

🔍 About Odevo

🌐 Our Software
Show more

Title: AI Data Software Engineer
Description:
Om oss

Vi bygger nu upp vår AI-avdelning och vi letar därför efter dedikerade utvecklare som vill bli en del av vårt team. Du kommer att få möjlighet att arbeta med spännande AI-lösningar, samarbeta med ett dynamiskt team och vara med och bygga vår AI-kapacitet.




Om rollen

Vi söker en erfaren AI Data & Software engineer som ska ansvara för databehandling, bygga och träna maskininlärningsmodeller och utveckla AI-drivna applikationer. Om du brinner för att utforska data, finjustera modeller och skapa innovativa AI-lösningar med hjälp av toppmoderna verktyg och tekniker är den här rollen perfekt för dig.




Ansvarsområden

Samla in, rensa och förbehandla data för att bygga högkvalitativa dataset för träningsmodeller
Utveckla, träna och utvärdera maskininlärningsmodeller
Optimera och finjustera modeller för prestanda och noggrannhet
Bygga och distribuera AI-applikationer som utnyttjar dessa modeller i containeriserade miljöer
Ta hänsyn till säkerhet och efterlevnad under hela datahanterings- och modell distributionsprocessen
Ha ett nära samarbete med driftsättnings- och optimeringsteamet för att säkerställa sömlös integration
Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom AI och maskininlärning




Din profil

Kunskaper i Python, C/C++ och andra AI-relevanta språk
Stark erfarenhet av ramverk för maskininlärning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)
Erfarenhet av NVIDIA:s hårdvaru- och mjukvarustack (CUDA, cuDNN, TensorRT)
Kunskaper i databehandling och manipulation (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Praktisk erfarenhet av modellutvärdering och optimering
Erfarenhet av containeriseringstekniker (Docker, Kubernetes)
Gedigen förståelse för AI-modellsäkerhet, datasekretess och etiska överväganden
God problemlösningsförmåga och ett öga för detaljer
Show more

Title: Fraud Analyst/Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about data-driven fraud prevention? We are looking for a Fraud Analyst/Data Scientist to join our fraud team. In this role, you will work with ML/AI models, advanced analytics, and real-time data to detect and prevent fraud.

You will analyze large datasets, develop predictive models, and create dashboards to track fraud patterns and trends. Working closely with Credit Underwriting, IT, and Data Engineering teams, you will help enhance fraud detection capabilities and optimize decision-making processes. Your work will play a key role in shaping data-driven fraud prevention strategies.

If you enjoy working with data, automation, and predictive analytics to solve real-world challenges, this is an exciting opportunity to make an impact in a fast-moving environment.

Who You Are


5+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and statistical modeling.
Experience with SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools (SAS, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to translate data into insights and drive business decisions.
Experience in financial fraud prevention and/or fraud risk management is a plus.



Resurs in brief

At Resurs, we make everyday finances easier through innovative and customer-focused solutions. With customers across the Nordics and a team of around 700 colleagues, we are committed to delivering long-term value for individuals, businesses, and society. Being named a career company for the past six years, we have a strong focus on emphasizing both personal and professional growth. With an inclusive and diverse culture, we create a workplace where employees are valued, supported, and encouraged to reach their full potential.

Join an international team

Although we are based in the Nordics, our team is enriched by the breadth of perspectives brought by colleagues from countries such as South Africa, Australia, Iran, Germany, New Zealand, the US, and India. We foster a welcoming and supportive culture, where collaboration drives us to achieve the best outcomes for our users.

Apply today!

Don’t wait to send in your application. Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the last application date.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Important information

On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company.


In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.



Resurs has more than 40 years of experience in retail finance and is one of the leading niche banks in the Nordics. We help companies and private individuals with lending, savings and payments. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 650 employees in the Nordic region.

Follow us on Instagram:

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life

Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).



Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.

Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Open Banking
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

At Visa, our Data Science team within the Banking and Lending Technology (BLT) area leverages machine learning technologies to enrich transaction data and develop our foundational models. We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist who will be instrumental in driving the next generation of banking and lending solutions. You will work with cutting-edge ML technologies, leveraging your expertise to extract structured information from transaction descriptions and deploy ML systems in high throughput environments.As a member of our team, you will:


Develop and implement machine learning models to enrich transaction data.
Work closely with our engineering team to integrate models into our MLOps pipeline using Kubeflow.
Train models on accelerated hardware like GPUs using PyTorch.
Deploy and scale ML systems using Nvidia Triton Inference server.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our models meet business needs and performance standards.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications


Master's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or other quantitative field.
3-5 years of work experience, preferably from building products rather than internal analysis/support.
Fluent in Python and SQL (BigQuery).
Experience with Deep Learning frameworks, particularly PyTorch.
Experience working in an MLOps pipeline, preferably with Kubeflow.
Proven experience training models on accelerated hardware like GPUs.
Strong interest in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and algorithms.
Mastery of concepts related to time and memory complexity.
Interest in deploying ML systems in high throughput environments.


Bonus:

You have proven experience with agentic LLM flows for producing structured data.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer within Advisory and Analytics | SEB
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you looking for a meaningful challenge and an opportunity to grow? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!

About Us

Join our vibrant Data Analytics ART team, which spans Stockholm and Vilnius and works within Google Cloud. We focus on gathering and providing datasets to support customer insights and enhance relationships and experiences. With your expertise, we can unlock even greater possibilities.

Your role:

As a member of the Data Analytics ART team, you will:


Develop machine learning solutions that drive customer insights and innovation.
Utilize a diverse tech stack, including Git, Kafka, RESTful APIs, BigQuery, and Vertex AI.
Apply best practices for continuous integration to manage GCP-deployed products.
Design innovative technical solutions while engaging in workshops, hackathons, and tech guilds.


Required Skills

Must-have skills:


A background in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent practical experience in machine learning or data analytics.
Several years of experience in designing, implementing, and deploying ML models using GCP services like Vertex AI or BigQuery ML.
Proficiency in Python and bash scripting for automating workflows.
Proven experience in designing and developing scalable REST APIs for machine learning or data analytics applications.
Familiarity with Terraform, Docker, and SQL for infrastructure and data management.
Experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines.
Hands-on experience working in Linux environments.


Nice-to-have Skills


Proficiency in test-driven development and creating a continuous testing platform.
Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow for developing deep learning models.
Familiarity with IT security principles, particularly in the context of ML pipelines and data storage.


If you don’t meet every requirement listed but are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply.

Personal Attributes


Self-driven and enjoys tackling varied technical challenges.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Innovative, curious, and open to starting from scratch.
A growth mindset, eager to learn and adapt in a rapidly changing technical landscape.


What we offer:


Extensive training and learning opportunities.
Access to SEB staff banking and exclusive benefits.
A prestigious team with experienced colleagues who value cooperation and openness.
Opportunity to share knowledge by pair programming, demos, etc.
A workplace where we care about the work-life balance.
An innovative company at the forefront of technology
Hybrid Workplace Setup
Extensive training and learning opportunities.


Our fundamental belief is that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in, or where they come from.

Welcome with your application.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application already today but not later than the 31st of March.

You will be joining one of the largest financial based organisation within Sweden working with an extensive tech team delivering a first class product within Wealth management. This team is looking for Senior developers with a strong background in .Net / C# to join supporting a platform used globally.




The role:




Our client is on a journey to create a first class platform supporting clients within the financial space. They are looking to find exceptional developers with strong Microsoft experience to join a team of 7 over the coming months.




5 Years + of experience in Software development

Experience within DevOps -

Title: Data Scientist - Image Analysis & Software Development
Description:
The role

We are seeking a skilled data scientist or image analyst with expertise in developing image analysis pipelines and software solutions to join our R&D team. The successful candidate will focus on the development and optimization of our image analysis pipeline, transforming raw microscope images into high-quality, quantitative biological data.

Working closely with the software team, this role will also contribute to enhancing Hyperplex PCR™ assays by refining how numerical results and quality metrics are visualized, ensuring a seamless, intuitive, and user-friendly software experience. The position is ideal for an action-driven problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced start-up environment and enjoys working at the intersection of data science, software development, and molecular diagnostics.




Responsibilities

Develop and refine image analysis modules to extract reproducible, quantitative results from microscopy images, including tasks such as 2D/3D feature segmentation, signal intensity analysis, spectral unmixing, and deconvolution.
Conduct systematic performance evaluations of image analysis pipelines and develop quality control metrics for datasets and experiments.
Automate and optimize software pipelines to improve computational efficiency, robustness, and scalability in high-throughput environments.
Design and integrate user-friendly interfaces (UI) for seamless interaction with image analysis tools and visualization of experiment results, including figures, tables, plots and images.
Maintain rigorous documentation of algorithms, software components, and experimental workflows.
Work closely with the R&D, bioassay, and service teams to balance performance and quality between assays and image analysis.
Maintain project timelines, document results, and communicate findings effectively.
Contribute to risk management activities to ensure smooth project execution.




Skills & Requirements

We’re looking for a candidate with a strategic mindset, action-driven approach, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and agile environment. This individual should possess meticulous attention to detail and a proactive approach to achieving project milestones, as well as the flexibility to adapt to evolving methods. The ideal candidate can communicate effectively at all organizational levels, build strong relationships with customers, and demonstrate a genuine passion for enabling new technologies with software. The candidate does not need to be proficient in biology, chemistry of physics, but preferably enjoys to learn about these subjects.

Required:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and relevant libraries such as OpenCV, scikit-image, NumPy, and SciPy.
Strong skills in data visualization, statistical analysis, and quality control.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Valid work authorization for Sweden.

Preferred:

Strong proficiency in Python and key scientific libraries, including NumPy, scikit-image, scikit-learn, and OpenCV.
Skilled in statistical analysis, including data classification, regression, and clustering.
Proficient in data visualization using tools such as HoloViz, Plotly, Matplotlib or equivalent
Experience in GPU programming for high-performance image processing applications.
Expertise in deep learning model development, including architecting, training, and fine-tuning models for object detection and semantic segmentation.
Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.
Industry experience in software development, with a focus on life sciences and medical applications, including UI development utilizing D3.js, Vue.js, React.js, or similar technologies .
Strong expertise in image processing and analysis, particularly in fluorescence microscopy.
Experience in bioinformatics, molecular diagnostics, or in situ analysis.




What we offer

An ambitious, innovative, inclusive and professional environment.
Being part of building a cross-disciplinary technology at the frontier of its space.
Primarily working on-site rather than remote to interact heavily with the R&D and Product teams.
Nordic level salary with 5 weeks annual paid vacation.
Stock option program.




Terms of employment

This is a 1 year full-time salary position available immediately, that can lead to full-time employment. The position is based on site in Aplex Bio’s facility on KI campus.




Application

Apply through: https://emp.jobylon.com/jobs/261709-aplex-bio-data-scientist-image-analysis-software-development/

Title: Python Developer
Description:
The Team:

The development team is based in Stockholm. It consists of highly skilled and helpful individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing a unique part in serving our global customer base. We value learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.




The Impact:

OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade processing. Our products within the Trade Lifecycle division cover many of these areas, such as portfolio reconciliation, risk calculations, collateral management, and settlement automation. Improving these systems has a real impact on reducing the systemic risk of the global financial market while boosting operational efficiency and producing cost savings for many of the largest banks in the world.




What’s in it for you:

Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including e.g. Python, Elm, Kubernetes, relational and NoSQL databases)
Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)




Responsibilities:

Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
Uphold architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
Mentor colleagues
Understanding customer requirements/needs




What We’re Looking For:

3-10 years of relevant experience
An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you, and our ways of working
Good communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week




We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:

A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
An interest in financial markets







About OSTTRA




Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.




OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.




Learn more at www.osttra.com.




What’s In It For You?




Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.




Our benefits include:

Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries




-----------------------------------------------------------




Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

Show more
HTML:
The Team:

The development team is based in Stockholm. It consists of highly skilled and helpful individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing a unique part in serving our global customer base. We value learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.


The Impact:

OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade processing. Our products within the Trade Lifecycle division cover many of these areas, such as portfolio reconciliation, risk calculations, collateral management, and settlement automation. Improving these systems has a real impact on reducing the systemic risk of the global financial market while boosting operational efficiency and producing cost savings for many of the largest banks in the world.


What’s in it for you:

  • Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
  • Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
  • Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
  • Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including e.g. Python, Elm, Kubernetes, relational and NoSQL databases)
  • Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)


Responsibilities:

  • Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
  • Uphold architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
  • Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
  • Mentor colleagues
  • Understanding customer requirements/needs


What We’re Looking For:

  • 3-10 years of relevant experience
  • An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you, and our ways of working
  • Good communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
  • Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week


We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:

  • A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
  • An interest in financial markets



About OSTTRA


Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.


OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.


Learn more at www.osttra.com.


What’s In It For You?


Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.


Our benefits include:

  • Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  • Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  • Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  • Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  • Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  • Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries


-----------------------------------------------------------


Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data team and drive the Data & Analytics strategy for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open-world game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios!

This role will be responsible for owning and developing analytics strategies and collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams. It requires experience from live product environments, strong leadership skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with our publishing partner, Microsoft. This is a key role that combines technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership to ensure that Contraband delivers exceptional player experiences and meets its business goals.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement robust analytics strategies tailored to a live premium AAA game.
Collaborate with Data, Product, Creative, and Tech teams to align analytics efforts with broader project goals.
Design and implement advanced data models, pipelines, A/B tests and dashboards to monitor game performance and player behavior.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable insights that guide game and business decisions.
Ensure seamless communication and collaboration with Microsoft’s Business, Product, Data, and Tech teams to drive analytics success.
Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices, mentoring the team, and providing training across the organization.
Design efficient and scalable analytics processes, conducting regular code and methodology reviews.


Who You Are


Proven experience (5+ years) as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in gaming or digital entertainment.
Proven experience leading analytics strategies for live games or similar live product environments, ideally in the premium AA or AAA gaming space.
Expertise in visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R.
Advanced SQL Skills: Writing complex, optimized SQL queries and understanding query performance tuning.
Experience collaborating across disciplines (Product, Creative, Tech) and with publishers.
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to diverse audiences along with the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A passion for gaming!


Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.

The Stockholm location

Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.

Our values

At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.

How To Apply

To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.

Title: Senior AI Developer
Description:
Senior AI Developer – Prompt Engineering & AI-Agentutveckling




Vill du utveckla AI-lösningar i framkant och forma nästa generations intelligenta system? 

På Nordisk Ai får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla skalbara, affärskritiska AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för företag.

Vi söker en Senior AI Developer med expertis inom prompt engineering och AI-agentutveckling. Rollen är perfekt för dig som har en djup teknisk förståelse för stora språkmodeller (LLMs) och erfarenhet av att bygga, optimera och implementera AI-drivna system.




Om Nordisk Ai

På Nordisk Ai gör vi AI enkelt för alla. Vi hjälper företag att förstå, implementera och dra nytta av AI utan onödig komplexitet. Genom att kombinera avancerad teknik med en användarvänlig approach skapar vi innovativa AI-lösningar som ger företag en konkurrensfördel.

Vi är en snabbväxande startup där innovation, samarbete och teknisk expertis står i centrum. Vi jobbar i gränslandet mellan AI-forskning och affärsnytta, och nu söker vi en senior utvecklare som vill vara med och ta Nordisk AI till nästa nivå.




Om rollen

Som Senior AI Developer hos Nordisk AI får du en central roll i vårt AI-team. Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla, optimera och implementera AI-drivna agenter och avancerade AI-lösningar.

Detta är en strategisk och tekniskt avancerad roll där du får stor frihet och möjlighet att påverka AI-utvecklingen hos både Nordisk AI och våra kunder.




Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:

Strategi och utveckling – Driva utvecklingen av AI-drivna agenter för automatisering och affärsprocesser.
Prompt engineering & optimering – Skapa och finjustera prompts för att förbättra precision, relevans och svarstid i LLM-modeller.
Modellutveckling & AI-optimering – Träna, finjustera och optimera AI-modeller för specifika användningsområden.
AI-arkitektur & systemintegration – Implementera och integrera AI-lösningar i tekniska ekosystem.
MLOps & deployment – Sätta upp CI/CD-pipelines och hantera drift av AI-modeller i molnmiljöer.
Tekniskt ledarskap – Vara en expert inom AI och NLP, dela kunskap och vägleda team inom AI-strategi och best practices.




Vi söker dig som:

Har en relevant utbildning eller gedigen erfarenhet inom AI.
Har minst 2-5 års erfarenhet av AI-utveckling, LLM, NLP eller maskininlärning.
Har god förståelse för GPT-4, Claude, Gemini eller andra LLM-modeller.
Har djup kunskap inom prompt engineering och erfarenhet av att optimera språkmodeller.
Har stark programmeringskunskap och erfarenhet av relevanta AI-ramverk.
Har erfarenhet av att bygga AI-drivna applikationer och konversationsagenter.
Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift (krav).




Meriterande:

Tidigare erfarenhet från startup-miljö och B2B-projekt.
Kunskap inom WordPress, MemberPress och andra ledande AI-modeller.




Varför Nordisk Ai?

Teknisk innovation – Vi arbetar med den senaste AI-tekniken och experimenterar kontinuerligt med LLM, reinforcement learning och AI-automatisering.
Frihet att påverka – Som senior AI-utvecklare får du stor teknisk frihet att välja verktyg, sätta riktlinjer och påverka vår AI-strategi.
Snabbväxande team – Vi är en agil och snabbfotad organisation där beslut fattas snabbt och idéer snabbt omsätts i handling.
AI på riktigt – Vi jobbar inte bara med AI som en trend, utan som en affärskritisk funktion för våra kunder.
Entreprenöriell anda – Nytänkande och experimentlusta är en naturlig del av vår vardag.




Hos oss får du:

Stort inflytande – Du är med och formar våra produkter, vår tech-stack och vår övergripande AI-strategi.
Flexibelt arbetssätt – Vi erbjuder hybridlösning med möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
Snabbhet & innovation – Vi är en snabbfotad organisation där idéer snabbt kan bli verklighet, och där experimenterande är en självklar del av vardagen.
Ett dedikerat team – Du jobbar tillsammans med andra experter i ett tight, kunnigt och engagerat team där alla brinner för AI på riktigt.




Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens AI-lösningar med verklig påverkan? Då har vi plats för dig.




Så ansöker du

Är du redo att bygga nästa generations AI-agenter?




Skicka in din ansökan med CV och en kort beskrivning om vem du är som person.

Plats: Stockholm (eller remote för rätt kandidat).

Start: Enligt överenskommelse.

Anställningsform: Heltid, tillsvidare.

Urval sker löpande, ansök så snart som möjligt.




Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.

Välkommen till Nordisk Ai – där vi gör AI enkelt för alla.




Show more

  • Flexibelt arbetssätt – Vi erbjuder hybridlösning med möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
  • Snabbhet & innovation – Vi är en snabbfotad organisation där idéer snabbt kan bli verklighet, och där experimenterande är en självklar del av vardagen.
